0904	席	席	Mat	10	<i>Caverns ... towel</i>.[10]			xí	<i>Caverns</i> = <i>cave</i> + <i>twenty</i><br />{&quot;巾 fabrics upon which 廿 (twenty=) many persons sit 广 in the house&quot; --Karlgren(1923).}	banquet; woven mat			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AEu"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">席的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=AE75"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">席的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%B8%AD"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">席在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1193"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">席在RTK：seat</span></a>	RTH
0905	度	度	Degrees	9	This key word refers to a gradation of measurement, not to academic diplomas. Its primitives: <i>caverns ... crotch</i>.[9]			dù	{From 广 (guǎng) 'house', 廿 (niàn) 'twenty', and 又 (yòu) 'hand'.<br />        &quot;To have 又 in one's hand 廿 (twenty:) all the inhabitants of 广 the house: rule, regulate, cf. 庶 and 妥&quot; --Karlgren.}	degree, standard; capacity			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AB%D7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">度的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=ABD7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">度的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%BA%A6"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">度在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1194"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">度在RTK：degrees</span></a>	RTH

0913	勝	胜	Victory	12	<i>Moon ... quarter ... muscle</i>.[12]			shèng	{The full form 勝 is composed of 朕 zhèn phonetic, and 力 (lì) 'strength' (the similarity to 券 quàn is accidental). The left side was originally 舟 zhōu 'boat', not 月 yuè 'moon' or 肉 ròu 'meat'.}	victorious; victory; to be better than			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B3%D3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">勝的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B3D3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">勝的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%83%9C"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">胜在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%83%9C"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1209"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">勝在RTK：victory</span></a>	RTH

0915	版	版	Printing Plate	8	Although this character also carries the sense of an "edition" of a publication, the elemnts, <i>slice</i> and <i>against</i>, more readily suggesat its other meaning of a <b>printing plate</b>, or the thin slice of metal which is covered with ink and pressed <i>against</i> the surface to be printed on.[8]			bǎn		a block of printing; an edition, version, page			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AA%A9"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">版的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=AAA9"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">版的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%89%88"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">版在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1213"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">版在RTK：printing block</span></a>	RTH

0922	乏	乏	weary	4	<i>Eyedropper ... sign of Zorro</i>.[4]			fá	{The seal form of 乏 was the mirror image of 正 zhèng 'correct'.<br />        &quot;The inversion means that one did not 止 reach the 一 line, the point where one had to reach; a defect, to be in want of, exhausted. The modern character is a fanciful abbreviation that has nothing in common with 之 zhī&quot; --Wieger.}	short of; tired			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A5F"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">乏的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A546"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">乏的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B9%8F"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">乏在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1215"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">乏在RTK：destitution</span></a>	RTH

0932	柔	柔	gentle	9	<i>Spear ... tree</i>.[9]			róu	{From 矛 (máo) 'spear' and 木 (mù) 'wood'.<br />        &quot;木 wood used for making 矛 lances&quot; --Karlgren.<br />        Flexible wood which bends instead of breaking. 0934	務	务	Tasks	11	<i>Spear ... taskmaster ... muscle</i>.[11]			wù	{Originally 矛 (máo) 'spear', 攵(攴 pū) 'beat', and 力 (lì) 'strength', meaning to apply one's force. An old form 敄, without 力, survives in 婺瞀蝥鍪骛鹜.<br />        攵 was reduced by one stroke to 夂, giving the modern full form 務. 矛 was deleted, giving the modern simple form 务.}	affair, business, matter			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B0%C8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">務的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B0C8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">務的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%8A%A1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">务在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%8A%A1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1227"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">務在RTK：task</span></a>	RTH

0943	強	强	strong	11	<i>Bow ... elbow ... insect</i>.[11]		(<u>not</u> <i>healthy</i>)	qiáng	{The left side is 弓 gōng 'bow'. The right side 虽 is the modern simple form of 虽(雖) suī 'although'. A 弓 bow is strong, 虽 although it bends.<br />        The true explanation is obscure. An older form was 彊, with 畺 jiāng phonetic.<br />        "The character originally meant 'the larva of the corn-weevil' and was applied, as abbreviation for 彊, to the homophonous word 'strong'..." --Karlgren.<br />        The form 強 (with 厶 rather than 口) is one stroke less, but perversely we call 强 the "simple" form and 強 the "full" form, only because 强 is in the simple-form GB standard and 強 is in the full-form Big5 standard. This is one of those absurd situations where the "simple" form has more strokes than the "full" form.}	strength; force; power; powerful			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B1j"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">強的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B16A"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">強的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%BC%BA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">强在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%BC%BA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1235"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">強在RTK：strong</span></a>	RTH

0993	降	降	to descend	9	<i>Pinnacle ... walking legs ... monocle</i>. Note that the drawing of monocle in the character for year,where it was first introduced (FRAME 806) was somewhat irregular because it doubled up with other strokes. From now on <i>monocle</i> will be written as shown below.[9]			jiàng	{The left side is 阝(阜 fù) 'hill' (picture of steps). 1030	幾	几	how many?	12	<i>Two cocoons ... person ... fiesta</i>. [12]	As a primitive this character will mean an <i>abacus</i>, the bead-instrument used in the Orient to caculate <i>how many</i>. Be sure you don't confuse this <i>abacus</i> with the one that appeared in the story fo <i>calculate</i> in FRAME 733.		jǐ		how many? how much?; a few, some			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B4X"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">幾的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B458"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">幾的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%87%A0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">几在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%87%A0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1381"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">幾在RTK：how many</span></a>	RTH

1039	系	系	Lineage	7		As a primitive, this character will take the meaning of <i>yarn</i>, as the uniting of many <i>threads</i> into <i>one</i> (slightly warped) strand is most obvious with <i>yarn</i>.		xì		link, connection; system			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A8t"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">系的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A874"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">系的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%B3%BB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">系在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1391"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">系在RTK：lineage</span></a>	RTH

1098	餐	餐	to dine	16	<i>Magic wand ... evening ... right hand/crotch ... food</i>. [16]			cān	{The bottom is 食 (shí) 'food'.<br>        The top, 歺又, is an obsolete character employed in 餐 as a phonetic. The upper left part, 歺, composed of 卜 over 夕, is just a variant of 歹 dǎi 'broken bone'. The upper right is 又 yòu 'hand'. A 又 hand holding a 歹 broken bone seems appropriate for carnivorous meals. Now 歺 is often used as an unauthorized simplified form of 餐, one sees it especially on street signs in the word 歺厅(餐厅) cāntīng 'dining hall'.}	eat, dine; meal; food			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C0\"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">餐的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C05C"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">餐的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%A4%90"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">餐在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2798"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">餐在RTK：repast</span></a>	RTH

[16]			guǎn		house; establishment, public building			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C0]"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">館的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C05D"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">館的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%A6%86"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">馆在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%A6%86"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1478"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">館在RTK：bldg.</span></a>	RTH

[15]		(animals, family, etc.)	yǎng		to raise, rear, keep			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BEi"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">養的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BE69"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">養的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%85%BB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">养在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%85%BB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1479"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">養在RTK：foster</span></a>	RTH
1101	既	既	since	9	<i>Silver ... waitress</i>. The key word since should not be used as a preposition or adverb to indicated "from a point in the past," but as a conjunction meaning "now that." [9]			jì	{==== 旡 [jì] (component: 'belch' -- 欠 backwards; as in 既簪 etc.)<br />"To belch -- the seal was a symbol analogous to those of 气 and 欠; to be distinguished from 无" --Karlgren.<br />        A very similar character was pronounced zān and meant hair-pin; it is now written 簪 zān; also see 昝 zǎn.}	already; since; de facto			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%ACJ"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">既的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=AC4A"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">既的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%97%A2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">既在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1481"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">既在RTK：previously</span></a>	RTH

[10]			xiōng	{From 月(肉 ròu) 'flesh' and 匈 xiōng.<br>        The character 匈 (made of 勹 and 凶 xiōng phonetic), already meant 'chest', but was enlarged by 肉 anyway. 勹 is simply 人 (rén) 'person', with room in the middle to show what's inside.}	chest, bosom, heart; mind			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AF%DD"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">胸的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=AFDD"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">胸的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%83%B8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">胸在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1491"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">胸在RTK：bosom</span></a>	RTH

1135	藝	艺	Technique	19	<i>Flowers ... rice stalk ... rising cloud</i>. [19]			yì	{"Agriculture, cultivate, art, profession; skill, cunning, rule, law; limit" --Karlgren.<br>        Originally 埶, from 坴 a 圥 plant on the 土 ground, and 丸 =  a hand planting it. To 埶 was added 艹 grass and 云 a cloud to water the crop, producing 藝 which is the full form. The simple form 艺 is just 艹 grass over 乙 yǐ phonetic.<br>        埶 also occurs in 热(熱) rè and 势(勢) shì.}	skill; art			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C3%C0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">藝的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C3C0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">藝的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%89%BA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">艺在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%89%BA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2352"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">藝在RTK：technique [old]</span></a>	RTH

[12]			hán	{"The seal has a 宀 roof, 艹(艸) doubled, in the middle 人 a man and below 冫 ice --- the whole now badly deformed: a 人 man laying up 艸 fuel in 宀 the house against 冫 the cold" --Karlgren.<br />        It is also possible that the 艹 grass was used to fill cracks in the walls, to conserve heat.}	cold, poor; to tremble			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B4H"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">寒的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B448"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">寒的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%AF%92"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">寒在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1526"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">寒在RTK：cold</span></a>	RTH

1150	素	素	Vegetarian Diet	10	<i>Grow up ... thread</i>. [10]			sù	{The bottom is 糸 (sī) 'silk'. The top  represents mulberry branches, from which wild silkworm cocoons are collected.}	plain; vegetarian; formerly, normally			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AF%C0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">素的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=AFC0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">素的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%B4%A0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">素在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1532"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">素在RTK：elementary</span></a>	RTH
1151	青	青	blue or green	8		<i>telescope</i>		qīng	{ stands for 生 shēng 'life', and 月 for 丹 (dān) 'red' (丹田 dāntián).<br>        "The 丹 hue of 生 growing plants. . . . But 丹 means RED! Was the inventor of 青 a Daltonian?" --Wieger. (Daltonism = red/green color blindness.)<br>        "The 丹 color of 生 vegetation, 生 in the same time phonetic" --Karlgren. (Karlgren regarded this explanation as "far-fetched".)}	green (blue, black); Qinghai Prv. (abbrev.)			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%ABC"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">青的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=AB43"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">青的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%9D%92"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">青在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1534"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">青在RTK：blue</span></a>	RTH
1152	精	精	refined	14	<i>Rice ... telescope</i>. [14]			jīng	{Why 米 rice? Because rice is PERFECT every time. Rice is the ESSENCE of Chinese food, and is used to make ALCOHOL (酒精).}	refined, perfect; essence; semen			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BA%EB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">精的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BAEB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">精的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%B2%BE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">精在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1535"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">精在RTK：refined</span></a>	RTH

1157	靜	静	quiet	16	<i>Telescope ... contend</i>. [16]			jìng	{Strangely, 青 qīng ('green') and 争(爭) zhèng ('struggle') both seem to be phonetic in 静 jìng. Compare the variant forms 靖 and 竫, both with 立 (lì) 'stand' and either 青 or 爭 as phonetic. 靖 is still used in the word 绥靖 suíjìng 'pacify', whereas 竫 is obsolete.}	still, calm, quiet, motionless			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C0R"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">靜的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C052"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">靜的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%9D%99"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">静在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%9D%99"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1540"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">靜在RTK：quiet（静）</span></a>	RTH

1161	表	表	Surface	8	<i>Grow up ... scarf</i>. [8]		(<u>not</u> <i>covering</i>)	biǎo	{Originally from 衣 (yī) 'clothing' and 毛 (máo) 'hair', now written  (four strokes) over  (also four strokes).<br />        "The outside of a garment, outside, external; (outsiders:) relatives of a different family name; (the side that is seen:) conspicuous, to manifest; a signal; a watch, thermometer etc; schedule -- the 毛 hairy side of 衣 the (fur) garment" --Karlgren.<br />        For the meaning 'watch' (as in 'wrist-watch'), the variant form 錶 (with 金 jīn 'metal' added) is sometimes used (but not among simple form characters).}	surface, exterior; to show, express			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AA%ED"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">表的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=AAED"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">表的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%A1%A8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">表在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1546"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">表在RTK：surface</span></a>	RTH

1169	慧	慧	intelligent	15	Two <i>bushes ... broom ... heart</i>. 1170	豐	丰	plentiful	18	Two <i>bushes ... broom ... heart</i>. It might help to think of a "hill of beans." [18]			fēng	{        It was doubled (second form from right), then various things were added; the full form 豐 has 丰 doubled over 山 and 豆. However, for the meaning "good-looking", the simple form 丰 is used even among full form characters.<br />        The simple form 丰 is the same as the oldest form, except that the top line is straightened out.}	abundant, lush, bountiful, plenty			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C2%D7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">豐的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C2D7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">豐的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">丰在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1443"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">豐在RTK：bountiful（豊）</span></a>	RTH
1171	春	春	Springtime	9	<i>Bonsai ... sun</i>. [9]			chūn	{"The spring; gay, wanton -- the small seal has 艸 vegetation reviving under the influence of 日 the sun, 屯 (tún) phonetic; this, however, may be a remaking of the character, and the original upper part may have depicted a tree or bush" --Karlgren.<br />        In fact, the oldest form is just 桑 (sāng) 'mulberry tree' over 日 (rì) 'sun'. The top of the modern character is , which happens to be like the tops of 泰 tài, 奏 zòu, 奉 fèng, and 秦 Qín.}	spring(time); festive, joyful			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%ACK"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">春的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=AC4B"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">春的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%98%A5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">春在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1568"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">春在RTK：springtime</span></a>	RTH
1172	泰	泰	tranquil	10	<i>Bonsai ... snowflakes</i>. [10]		(<u>not</u> <i>peaceful</i>)	tài	{"The seal shows the upper part to be a fusion of 大 and 廾 () two hands, the lower is 水 water; the word is etymologically the same as 太 tài, and as 大 in one of its readings" --Karlgren.<br />        Notice that the bottom 氺 is five strokes.}	safe, peaceful; Thai(land); exalted, grand			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AE%F5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">泰的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=AEF5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">泰的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%B3%B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">泰在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1570"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">泰在RTK：peaceful</span></a>	RTH
1173	奉	奉	to proffer	8	<i>Bonsai ... cornstalk</i>. [8]			fèng	proffer = "to offer respectfully"<br />{The primary meaning is, to hold respectfully with both hands. The top is from  two hands holding a 丰 fēng bouquet, and the bottom is another hand ( = 扌 = 手 shǒu). 丰 is both signific and phonetic. Cognate with 捧 pěng; phonetic in 棒 bàng.}	to offer (tribute), pay respect, revere, esteem (ancestor, diety, etc.)			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A9^"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">奉的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A95E"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">奉的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%A5%89"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">奉在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1573"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">奉在RTK：dedicate</span></a>	RTH
1174	棒	棒	Cudgel	12	<i>Tree ... proffer</i>. [12]			bàng	{From 木 (mù) 'wood' and 奉 fèng 'hold respectfully with both hands'.<br />        The component 奉 is signific as well as phonetic in 棒 (it suggests both the meaning and the sound).}	a stick, club or cudgel			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B4%CE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">棒的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B4CE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">棒的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%A3%92"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">棒在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1575"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">棒在RTK：rod</span></a>	RTH

1179	難	难	difficult	19	<i>Popeye ... turkey</i>. [19]			nán	{From  (jiān) 'distress' and 隹 (zhuī) 'bird'. Cognate with 叹(嘆) tàn 'sigh'.  is the old form of 艰(艱) jiān 'difficult'. The role of 隹 'bird' is obscure, says Karlgren(1940). Wieger relates 難 to 暵 hàn 'parched':<br />        &quot;The state in which are the 隹 birds, when the earth is  dried and barren; famine, misery, difficulty of living&quot; --Wieger.<br />        In the simple form 难,  is abbreviated to 又 (yòu) 'hand': A 隹 bird in the 又 hand -- difficult, and a disaster for the bird.}	difficult (to...), arduous; problem, difficulty			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C3%F8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">難的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C3F8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">難的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%9A%BE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">难在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%9A%BE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1580"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">難在RTK：difficult</span></a>	RTH

1193	腰	腰	Waist	13	<i>Part of the body ... want</i>. [13]			yāo	{From 月(肉 ròu) 'flesh' and 要 yào.<br />        Originally 要 meant 'waist': it depicts a 女 woman with two hands pointing to her waist. 1194	票	票	Ticket	11	<i>Old West ... altar</i>. [11]			piào	{"Ignis fatuus (vulgo 鬼火 phantom-fire). The Chinese fear them. On the top, 覀 the bust of the hobgoblin. At the bottom, 火 the flame that takes the place of the body's lower part. In the middle, 一 the waist. The modern meanings of this character, a warrant, a bill, are 转注 zhuǎnzhù (things that are feared)" --Wieger.}	ticket; slip of paper, bank note			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B2%BC"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">票的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B2BC"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">票的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%A5%A8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">票在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1606"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">票在RTK：ballot</span></a>	RTH

[15]			jià		price; value			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BB%F9"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">價的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BBF9"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">價的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BB%B7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">价在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BB%B7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1603"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">價在RTK：value（価）</span></a>	RTH
1199	煙	烟	the Smoke	13	<i>Fireplace ... Old West ... ground</i>. [13]			yān	{==== 垔 [yīn] (old form of 堙 yīn 'build up')<br />"西 picture of a bird's nest built up with 土 earth, mud" --Karlgren.}	cigarette; tobacco, smoke			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B7%CF"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">煙的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B7CF"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">煙的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%83%9F"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">烟在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%83%9F"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1612"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">煙在RTK：smoke</span></a>	RTH
1200	南	南	South	9	<i>Belt ... good fortune</i>. Note how the <i>belt</i> runs through the middle of <i>good fortune</i>, which affects the stroke order<i>.</i> [9]			nán		south, the south; southern, southward			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%ABn"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">南的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=AB6E"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">南的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%8D%97"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">南在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1613"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">南在RTK：south</span></a>	RTH

1202	們	们	[plural]	10	<i>Person ... gate</i>. 1203	閒	闲	Leisure	12	<i>Gate ... moon</i>. [12]		(<u>not</u> <i>to rest</i>)	xián	{From 门(門 mén) 'door' and 木 (mù) 'tree'. Why do we see a 木 tree through the 門 door? We might also see the 日 (rì) sun or the 月 (yuè) moon. 闲(閑) xián 'free time' and 间(間) jiān 'space' were both formerly represented by 閒:<br />        &quot;A 門 door through the crevice of which the 月 moonshine peeps in&quot; --Karlgren.<br />        閑 xián once meant 'barrier' (&quot;The 木 wood piece across a 門 door&quot; --Karlgren). Now 闲(閑) is used in place of 閒 for xián 'free time'. This substitution might have been influenced by the function of 木 (mù) 'tree' in 休 xiū 'rest'.}	leisure; not busy; to stay idle, be unoccupied			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B6%A2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">閒的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B6A2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">閒的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%97%B2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">闲在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%97%B2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1625"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">閒 / 閑在RTK：leisure</span></a>	RTH
1204	問	问	to ask	11	<i>Gate ... mouth</i>. [11]			wèn	{From 门(門) mén 'door' and 口 (kǒu) 'mouth'.<br />        口 words spoken outside the 门 door. 门 mén is simultaneously phonetic and signific in 问 (it suggests both the sound and the meaning).<br />        Compare 闻 wén, 间 jiān.}	to ask, ask about, inquire after			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B0%DD"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">問的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B0DD"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">問的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%97%AE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">问在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%97%AE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1617"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">問在RTK：question</span></a>	RTH
1205	間	间	Interval	12	<i>Gate ... sun/day</i>. [12]			jiàn	{The 日 (rì) sun shining through the gap of a 门(門 mén) door. An older form 閒 had 月 (yuè) 'moon' rather than 日 'sun'. Also see 闲(閑) xián 'free time'.}	interval, space, interstice; place, between			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B6%A1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">間的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B6A1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">間的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%97%B4"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">间在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%97%B4"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1620"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">間在RTK：interval</span></a>	RTH
1206	簡	简	simple	18	<i>Bamboo ... interval</i>. [18]			jiǎn	{Originally 简 jiǎn meant 竹简 the bamboo strips which were used for writing on instead of paper. Then it meant a brief letter or note (etymologically the same word as 柬). Now it means short and simple.}	simple, terse, succinct			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C2%B2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">簡的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C2B2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">簡的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%AE%80"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">简在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%AE%80"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1621"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">簡在RTK：simplicity</span></a>	RTH
1207	開	开	to open	12	<i>Gate ... two hands</i>. [12]			kāi	{The full form 開 is 开 inside 門 (mén) 'door'. 开 is 廾() two hands reaching to remove the 一 bolt from the door. Compare 闩(閂) shuān 'door bolt'.}	open; operate or start (vehicle)			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B6}"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">開的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B67D"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">開的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%BC%80"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">开在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%BC%80"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1622"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">開在RTK：open</span></a>	RTH
1208	聞	闻	to hear	14	<i>Gate ... ear</i>. [14]			wén	{An 耳 ear listening at a 门 door. 门 mén is phonetic as well as signific, compare 问 wèn.}	hear; sniff at			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BBD"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">聞的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BB44"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">聞的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%97%BB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">闻在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%97%BB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1626"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">聞在RTK：hear</span></a>	RTH
1209	倉	仓	Storehouse	10	The single swinging door under the element for <i>meeting</i> is meant to represent not one <i>gate</i>, but many of them. Add <i>mouth</i> (as an entrance here) and the <i>meeting of gates</i> becomes a storehouse. [10]		(granary)	cāng	{Originally from 食 shí 'food' and 囗 wéi 'walls': food storehouse. The bottom has been abbreviated to 㔾 in the simple form.}	granary, storehouse, barn			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AD%DC"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">倉的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=ADDC"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">倉的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BB%93"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">仓在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BB%93"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1630"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">倉在RTK：godown</span></a>	RTH

1212	非	非	non—	8		<i>Jail cell</i>		fēi	{&quot;Said to be a symbol of contrariety; I rather think it is a variation of 飛 flying bird, homophonous to the abstract word here and therefore loaned&quot; --Karlgren.}	not, negative, wrong, non—, un—			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%ABD"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">非的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=AB44"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">非的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%9D%9E"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">非在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1632"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">非在RTK：un-</span></a>	leech RTH

1214	罪	罪	Guilt	13	<i>Eye/net ... jail cell</i>. 1215	靠	靠	to lean on	15	<i>Declare ... jail cell</i>. 1216	侯	侯	Marquis	9	<i>Person ... key ... dart</i>. [9]<br />(<i>Person ... shooting range</i>)			hóu	{A marquis: a 亻(人 rén) person who shoots 矢 (shǐ) arrows at a  target.<br />        “...The shooting at a target was used in antiquity, for the election of feudatories and officials...” --Wieger.}	marquis, lord; target in archery			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%ABJ"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">侯的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=AB4A"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">侯的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BE%AF"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">侯在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1639"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">侯在RTK：marquis</span></a>	RTH
1217	候	候	to wait	10	<i>Marquis ... walking stick</i>. [10]		(not <i>etc.</i>)	hòu	{From 侯 hóu ('marquis') phonetic, plus an extra vertical 丨 stroke. 候 hòu was formed by adding an extra 亻(人 rén) to 侯 hóu; subsequently one of the two 亻 was reduced to 丨.}	to wait; expect			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AD%D4"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">候的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=ADD4"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">候的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%80%99"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">候在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1640"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">候在RTK：climate</span></a>	RTH
1218	決	决	to decide	7	<i>water ... guillotine</i>. [7]			jué	{From 冫 or 氵 (水 shuǐ) 'water' and 夬 guài 'break through'.<br />        "Bifurcation of a river; rupture, break off, cut off, decide; certainly..." --Karlgren.<br />        Cognate with 夬 guài (name of the hexagram ).}	to decide, determine			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A8M"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">決的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A84D"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">決的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%86%B3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">决在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%86%B3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1641"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">決在RTK：decide</span></a>	RTH

1220	筷	筷	Chopsticks	13	<i>Bamboo ... fast</i>. 1221	韋	韦	Tanned Hide	9		<i>locket</i>		wéi	vis: Neo in his leather trenchcoat<br /><br />{Originally 囗 wéi 'surround' (possibly depicting city walls), surrounded by two right feet, the foot on top pointing to the left, the foot on the bottom pointing to the right. The full form 韋 is nine strokes. The simple form 韦 is four strokes.<br />        The character was borrowed for the meaning 'soft leather' which happened to have the same pronunciation; the original meaning may be preserved in 围(圍) wéi 'surround', 违(違) wéi 'go against' and 卫(衛) wèi 'defend'.}	soft leather, tanned leather			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AD%B3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">韋的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=ADB3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">韋的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%9F%A6"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">韦在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%9F%A6"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・	RTH

1225	干	干	to offend	3		<i>clothesline</i>		gān	{"Tree-stem used as battering ram or pestle" --Karlgren(1923).<br />        "It represents a pestle. Compare 午. By extension, to grind, to destroy; morally, to oppose, to offend against; blunt arms, offence, injury, etc." --Wieger.<br />        Etymologically the same word as 杆 gān and 竿 gān.<br />        Gān 'dry' is written 乾 in the full form. (Among simple form characters 乾 is used only for ☰ qián.)<br />        The full form of 干(幹) gàn 'do' is from ঝ and 人 over 干. 幹 gàn 'do' seems to be cognate with 干 gān 'tree-stem'; it also occurs in the word 树干(樹幹) shùgàn 'tree trunk':<br />        "Trunk of a tree; (wood material, manufacture:) to work, make, do, manage; work, occupation; ability" --Karlgren(1923).}	to oppose, interfere, invade			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A4z"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">干的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A47A"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">干的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%B9%B2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">干在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1648"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">干在RTK：dry</span></a>	RTH

1230	于	于	Yu	3		<i>clothing conveyor</i>	("clothing conveyor")	yú	{The vertical stroke is 亅, with a hook on the bottom; compare 干 gān which doesn't have a hook. The form 于 is "said to be a symbol of an exclamation, analogous to 丂 qiǎo and 乎 hū, cf. also 气 qì" --Karlgren.<br />        Formerly 于 was sometimes written 亏, but 亏 is now used as the simple form of 亏(虧) kuī.<br />        There is another character, 於 yú, which is sometimes used in place of 于 yú among full form characters. 於 is still in use among simple form characters for the surname 於 Yū.}	[a common surname]			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A4_"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">于的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A45F"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">于的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BA%8E"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">于在n词酷</span></a>・	RTH

1232	余	余	moi	7	<i>Umbrella ... clothing conveyor ... small</i>. [6]	<i>scale</i>		yú	{The character 余 yú formerly meant 'I, we':<br />        &quot;我也。自称发声之词。Composition: 从八 to distinguish; 从舍 contracted, 口 being replaced by 八. The Chinese custom required that anyone entering a 舍 house, 八 should make known his presence and distinguish himself from any other person by crying out: It is I, so and so, who comes for such and such a purpose...&quot; --Wieger.<br />        余 yú 'I' was also written 予 yú. But that old pronoun (along with 吾 wú) has been completely replaced by 我 wǒ in the modern language.<br />        Since the character 余 is obsolete in its original meaning, it was possible to recycle it by using it as the simple form of 餘 'left-over'. In fact there are two simple forms corresponding to 餘: the common one is 余 yú 'left-over', and the other is 馀 Yú, a surname. In 馀, 食 (shí) 'food' has been simplified to 饣 as usual, whereas in 余 it has been discarded.<br />        余 is phonetic in various characters pronounced quite differently in modern Mandarin. In 茶 chá 'tea', one of the horizontal strokes was lost.}	I, my me (imperial usage akin to the royal &quot;we&quot;)			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A7E"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">余的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A745"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">余的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BD%99"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">余在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1657"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">余在RTK：too much</span></a>	RTH

1238	辣	辣	spicy hot	14	<i>Chili peppers ... bundle</i>. [14]			là	{From 辛 (xīn) 'bitter suffering' and 束 (shù) 'bundle'.<br />        辣 là is etymologically the same word as 剌 là 'slash, cruel, perverse', from 束 'bundle' and 刂 ( = 刀 dāo) 'knife, cut'.<br />        四川菜 Sichuan cuisine is especially 辣 là.}	hot (spicy); pungent			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BB%B6"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">辣的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BBB6"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">辣的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%BE%A3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">辣在n词酷</span></a>・	RTH
1239	整	整	entire	16	<i>Bundle ... taskmaster ... correct</i>. [16]<br />(<i>imperial command</i> over <i>correct</i>)			zhěng	{From 敕 (chì) 'imperial command' over 正 zhèng 'straight, correct'. 整 and 正 are cognate.<br />        &quot;(Make straight:) regulate, arrange, adjust, repair; complete, whole -- the signific is 敕 command; certain commentators, however, take the parts separately: 'to 束 bind and 攵 beat a little, so as to make it 正 straight'&quot; --Karlgren.}	whole, complete, entire; orderly			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BE%E3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">整的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BEE3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">整的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%95%B4"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">整在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1670"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">整在RTK：organize</span></a>	RTH
1240	練	练	to practice	15	<i>Thread ... horned toad</i>. [15]			liàn	{The full form 練 is composed of 糸 (sī) 'silk' and 柬 jiǎn phonetic. The simple form 练 is 纟 plus . Notice that the component (柬 jiǎn) is not the same as 东(東 dōng 'east').<br />        &quot;To boil and bleach raw silk; purify; to discipline, to drill, to practise&quot; ---Karlgren.<br />        练(練) liàn 'white silk' is etymologically the same word as 炼(煉) liàn 'refine' (as in 锻炼 duànliàn 'exercise'). Compare 拣(揀) jiǎn 'choose'.}	to practice, train, drill; to perfect (one's skill)			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BDm"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">練的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BD6D"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">練的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%BB%83"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">练在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%BB%83"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1343"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">練在RTK：practice</span></a>	RTH

[9]			zhòng		heavy; serious			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AD%AB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">重的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=ADAB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">重的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%87%8D"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">重在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1675"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">重在RTK：heavy</span></a>	RTH

1249	瘋	疯	insane	14	<i>Sickness ... wind</i>. 1250	匹	匹	to match	4	<i>box ... human legs</i>. [4]		(&quot;to be equal to&quot;)	pī	{Karlgren says 八 bā is phonetic:<br />        &quot;Assort, assorted, equal, corresponding to; one of a pair, mate; (one of several:) ordinary, common, vulgar; measure of cloth (40 feet long) -- the signific is 匸 box (assort)&quot; --Karlgren(1923).<br />        Wieger's explanation is completely different:<br />        &quot;Half of a whole. The whole is represented by 四. A little more than the half of 四 was kept, so that the character is still recognisable; 分四为二也。一夫也。偶也。That which, being joined with its like, forms a pair, a match. See the compound 甚.&quot;}	mate; one of a pair			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A4%C7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">匹的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A4C7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">匹的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%8C%B9"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">匹在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1695"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">匹在RTK：equal</span></a>	RTH
1251	區	区	Region	11	<i>Box ... goods</i>. [11]			qū	{The full form 區 is 品 (pǐn) inside 匚. In the simple form 区, 品 is replaced by 㐅.<br />        &quot;To dispose, to stow away 品 things in a 匚 box; 从品在匚中, 会意。By extension, lodging, place, site; 四方也。&quot; --Wieger.<br />        Two words, qū and ōu, were synonymous and both represented by the character 区(區); now the pronunciation ōu survives only as a surname. 区 is phonetic in many characters, some pronounced qū, such as 躯驱岖, and others pronounced ōu, such as 欧鸥殴沤讴瓯.}	area, region, district			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B0%CF"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">區的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B0CF"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">區的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%8C%BA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">区在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%8C%BA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1696"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">區在RTK：ward（区）</span></a>	RTH

[15]			shū		hinge; pivot			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BC%CF"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">樞的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BCCF"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">樞的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%9E%A2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">枢在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%9E%A2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1697"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">樞在RTK：hinge（枢）</span></a>	RTH

1254	醫	医	Physician	18	<i>Box ... dart ... missile ... whiskey bottle</i>. [18]			yī	{Originally the character 医 was used for a word yì 'quiver':<br />        &quot;匚 case for 矢 arrows&quot; --Karlgren(1923).<br />        The full form of 医 is 醫, which is 殹 over 酉. 殹 is an obsolete character which meant 'the sound of hitting', from 医 yì phonetic and 殳 'hit', signific. 酉 (yǒu) 'wine vessel' was added to form 醫 since doctors use potions.<br />        医 yì 'quiver' is obsolete. 医 is now used as the simple form of 醫 'medical'.}	doctor, medicine; medical; to cure, treat			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C2%E5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">醫的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C2E5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">醫的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%8C%BB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">医在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%8C%BB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1694"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">醫在RTK：doctor（医）</span></a>	RTH
1255	仰	仰	to look up to	6	<i>Person ... stamp collection</i>. [6]			yǎng	{Originally 卬 depicted a person standing next to 卩 (jié) a person kneeling. Another 亻(人 rén) person was added later, forming 仰.<br />        仰 yǎng is cognate to 昂 áng 'lofty, high'.}	to look up, raise one's head			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A5%F5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">仰的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A5F5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">仰的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BB%B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">仰在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1701"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">仰在RTK：faceup</span></a>	RTH

1257	登	登	to ascend	12		stepladder		dēng	{癶 is two 止 feet; 豆 dòu means 'bean', but here meant 'pedestal'.<br />        &quot;To 癶 ascend upon a 豆 pedestal, firstly with one foot, then with the other&quot; --Wieger.}	to scale, climb, mount, ascend			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B5n"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">登的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B56E"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">登的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%99%BB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">登在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1703"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">登在RTK：ascend</span></a>	RTH
1258	燈	灯	Lamp	16	<i>Fire ... stepladder</i>. [16]			dēng		lamp; light			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BFO"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">燈的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BF4F"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">燈的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%81%AF"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">灯在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%81%AF"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2972"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">燈在RTK：lamp [old]</span></a>	RTH
1259	證	证	Evidence	19	<i>Words ... stepladder</i>. [19]		(<u>not</u> <i>evident</i>)	zhèng	{证(F證) [zhèng] prove <br />From 讠(言 yán) 'words' and 正 zhèng 'correct'.<br />        The full form 證 is composed of 言 and 登 dēng phonetic. Another character 証 was often used in place of 證; according to Karlgren 証 zhèng 'remonstrate' was etymologically the same word as 正 and 政. (说文: &quot;証, 諫也。&quot;)}	proof, evidence; to confirm			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C3%D2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">證的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C3D2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">證的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%AF%81"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">证在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%AF%81"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・	leech RTH
1260	發	发	to send out	12	Guided <i>missile</i> being shot from a <i>bow</i> through the hole at the top of a <i>teepee</i>. Inside the <i>missile</i> is a courier who will deliver the parcel in person. [12]	<i>courier</i>		fā	{The full form 發 is 癶 bò phonetic over 弓殳: to 殳 (shū) launch arrows with a 弓 (gōng) bow. (癶 also suggests the meaning: two 止 feet, &quot;separation, divergence, letting loose&quot; --Wieger). An old form had 矢 shǐ 'arrow' instead of 殳.}	to send out, issue, dispatch			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B5o"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">發的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B56F"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">發的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%8F%91"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">发在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%8F%91"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1705"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">發在RTK：discharge（発）</span></a>	RTH
1261	廢	废	to discard	15	<i>Cave ... courier</i>. [15]			fèi		to terminate, abolish, discard			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BCo"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">廢的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BC6F"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">廢的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%BA%9F"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">废在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%BA%9F"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1706"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">廢在RTK：abolish（廃）</span></a>	RTH
1262	形	形	Shape	7	<i>Two hands ... rooster tail</i>. [7]			xíng	{The 彡 three lines represent the shadow, and thus the shape, of an object (as in 影 yǐng). The left side 开 formerly looked like 井 jǐng 'well'. No relation to 开(開) kāi 'open'.<br />        According to Karlgren, 井 here was abbreviated from 耕 gēng phonetic; the same applies to 刑 xíng 'punishment'. Another theory is that the left side 井 (now 开) simply represented a frame, suggesting the meaning pattern, shape, form (--Henshall).}	form, shape; to appear, look			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A7%CE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">形的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A7CE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">形的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%BD%A2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">形在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1711"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">形在RTK：shape</span></a>	RTH
1263	影	影	Shadow	15	<i>Scenery ... rooster tail</i>. [15]			yǐng	{From 景 jǐng ('scenery') phonetic and 彡 (shān).<br />        彡 sometimes means 'hair' or 'feather'. In 影 it seems to represent a shadow, compare 形 xíng 'shape' and 彩 cǎi 'color'.}	reflection, shadow; picture, image			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BCv"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">影的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BC76"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">影的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%BD%B1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">影在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1712"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">影在RTK：shadow</span></a>	RTH
1264	彩	彩	Hue	11	<i>Pluck ... rooster tail</i>. [11]			cǎi	{From 采 cǎi 'pick' and 彡 (shān) 'feathers'.<br />        "Etymologically the same word as 采; character specifyingly enlarged by 彡" --Karlgren.<br />        Compare 形 xíng 'shape' and 影 yǐng 'shadow'.}	hue, color			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B1m"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">彩的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B16D"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">彩的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%BD%A9"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">彩在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1714"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">彩在RTK：coloring</span></a>	RTH
1265	須	须	to have to	12	<i>Rooster tail ... head</i>. [12]			xū	{Compare 需 xū (需要 xūyào 'need'). The difference is, 须 'must' generally goes with verbs and refers to a need (or obligation) to do something, whereas 需 'need' refers to things that are needed.}	must, have to, necessary			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B6%B7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">須的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B6B7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">須的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%A1%BB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">须在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%A1%BB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1718"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">須在RTK：ought</span></a>	RTH

1273	顏	颜	Countenance	18	<i>Erudite ... head</i>. [18]			yán	{From 彦 yàn 'elegant, handsome' and 页(頁 yè) 'head'.<br />彦 yàn is phonetic and also suggests the meaning.}<br /><br /><span style="font-size:small;">[[Main Entry: 1coun·te·nance<br />Pronunciation: \ˈkau̇n-tən-ən(t)s, ˈkau̇nt-nən(t)s\<br />Function: noun<br />Etymology: Middle English contenance, from Anglo-French cuntenance, contenance, from Medieval Latin continentia, from Latin, restraint, from continent-, continens, present participle of continēre to hold together — more at contain<br />Date: 13th century<br /><br />1 obsolete : bearing, demeanor<br />2 a : calm expression b : mental composure c : look, expression<br />3 archaic a : aspect, semblance b : pretense<br />4 : face, visage; especially : the face as an indication of mood, emotion, or character<br />5 : bearing or expression that offers approval or sanction : moral support]]</span>	countenance, face, color			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C3C"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">顏的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C343"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">顏的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%A2%9C"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">颜在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%A2%9C"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・	RTH
1274	產	产	Products	11	<i>Bungi-jumper ... cell</i>. [11]		(<u>not</u> <i>Goods</i>)	chǎn	{The full form 產 or 産 is like 彦(彥) yàn 'virtue', but with 生 shēng 'life' in place of 彡. In the simple form 产, 生 has been left out. 彦 yàn, which occurs in 颜 (颜色 yánsè 'color'), represents lines and wrinkles (like 文 wén).<br />        "The 彦 wrinkles formed on the body consequent upon 生 child-birth. Fecundity, to bear, to produce" --Wieger.<br />        "The signific is 生, interpretation of the rest uncertain" --Karlgren(1923).}	products, resources, property; to bring forth, give birth			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B2%A3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">產的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B2A3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">產的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BA%A7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">产在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BA%A7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1560"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">產在RTK：products（産）</span></a>	RTH
1275	率	率	a Rate	11	As in &quot;tax rate&quot;.<i> Top hat ... cocoon-sparkler ... needle</i>. [11]			shuài	{Said (by 说文) to depict a net for catching birds (like 毕畢 bì), but the oldest forms of 率 are simply 幺 (yāo) 'silk cocoons' surrounded by short strokes (threads?).<br />        &quot;Picture of a net; etymologically same word as 帅&quot; --Karlgren.<br />        It isn't clear how there came to be two such different pronunciations, shuài and lǜ, for the single character 率. The pronunciation lǜ is mentioned by neither Wieger nor Karlgren.}	ratio; rate; limit; to lead			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B2v"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">率的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B276"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">率的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%8E%87"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">率在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1737"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">率在RTK：ratio</span></a>	RTH

1283	色	色	Color	6	<i>Bound up ... mosaic</i>. [6]			sè	{The primary meaning is 'facial expression'. The top ⺈ seems to have originally been 人 (rén) 'person'. The bottom, now 巴 (bā), seems to derive from 卩 (jié) a person kneeling. Since 卩 at one time meant 'seal' (for stamping letters), a traditional explanation is that 色 means the color of ink.<br />        "That which a 人 man uses for his 卩 seal: printing ink, color" --Karlgren.<br />        "The color of the face corresponds with the feelings of the heart, as the stamp reproduces the seal" --Wieger.}	color; look, appearance			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A6%E2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">色的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A6E2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">色的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%89%B2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">色在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1753"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">色在RTK：color</span></a>	RTH
1284	絕	绝	to discontinue	12	<i>Thread ... color</i>. [12]			jué	{The left side is 纟(糸 sī) 'thread'.<br />        The right side is ⺈ or 刀 (dǎo) 'knife' over 巴 (which was originally 㔾 or 卩 jié phonetic). In the variant form 絶 and simple form 绝, the right side is written just like 色 (sè 'color').<br />        &quot;Has nothing to do with 色, for the seal has: to 刀 cut a 糸 thread, signific, and 㔾 phonetic&quot; --Karlgren(1923).}	to cut short, break off, discontinue; extinct			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B5%B4"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">絕的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B5B4"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">絕的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%BB%9D"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">绝在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%BB%9D"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1754"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">絕在RTK：discontinue（絶）</span></a>	RTH

1302	並	并	side by side	8		When the first three strokes are moved to the last three, the meaning will be <i>side by side and upside down</i>.		bìng	{並 derives from 竝, which is 立 (lì) 'stand' doubled: two people standing together.<br /><br />When the two forms 并 and 並 are treated as distinct, the verb is written with 并, or its more complex variant 併 (or 倂), while the adverb and conjunction are written with 並, as are most of the common compound words.}	equal to; side by side; what is more			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A8%C3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">並的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A8C3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">並的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%B9%B6"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">并在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%B9%B6"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1785"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">並在RTK：row</span></a>	RTH
1303	普	普	universal	12	<i>Side by side ... sun</i>. [12]			pǔ	{From 並 (bìng) 'together' over 日 (rì) 'sun'. 並 is a variant form of 并 bìng, two people 立 (lì) standing side by side.<br />         &quot;Universal, all, vast, great -- 並 taken together all the places where 日 the sun shines; cf. the phrase 普天下&quot; --Karlgren(1923).}	general, popular, universal			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B4%B6"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">普的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B4B6"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">普的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%99%AE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">普在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1786"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">普在RTK：universal</span></a>	RTH
1304	業	业	Profession	13	<i>Side by side and upside down ... not yet</i>. [13]			yè	{"A 木 tree crowded with its 丵 foliage. The moral foliage, the deeds of a man, the affairs upon which he exerts his activity, and what he acquires by his doings, viz. merits, goods, titles, etc." --Wieger.<br />        Only the highest leaves are left in the simple form 业.<br />        Some scholars believe 业(業) to have been a picture of a musical instrument, not a plant (Henshall).}	business, occupation; study			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B7~"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">業的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B77E"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">業的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%9A"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">业在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%9A"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1792"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">業在RTK：profession</span></a>	RTH
1305	對	对	that’s right	14	<i>Side by side and upside down ... soil ... glue</i>. [14]			duì	{The right side is 寸 (cùn) 'hand'. In the full form 對, the left side is 丵 over 一 (or 业 over 丷 over 王). The significance of this left side component, related to 業(业 yè), is obscure. It has been abbreviated to 又 in the simple form 对.}	correct, right; facing, opposed			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B9%EF"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">對的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B9EF"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">對的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%AF%B9"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">对在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%AF%B9"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1726"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">對在RTK：vis-a-vis（対）</span></a>	RTH
1306	共	共	together	6	<i>Salad ... animal legs</i>. [6]			gòng	{From 廿 (èrshí) 'twenty' over  a pair of hands. Twenty pairs of hands: sharing. An old form had two  pairs of hands linked together.}	all together, in common			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A6@"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">共的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A640"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">共的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%85%B1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">共在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1795"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">共在RTK：together</span></a>	RTH
1307	供	供	Supply	8	<i>Person ... together</i>. [8]			gōng	{From 亻(人 rén) 'person' and 共 gòng phonetic. 共 gòng 'share' also suggests both the meanings 'supply' and 'confess'.}	to supply, provide for; to offer in worship			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A8%D1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">供的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A8D1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">供的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BE%9B"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">供在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1796"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">供在RTK：submit</span></a>	RTH
1308	異	异	different	11	<i>Brains ... together</i>. [11]			yì	{The full form 異 is 田 over 共. It depicted a person wearing a scary mask (the head is like that of 鬼 guǐ 'demon'), waving hands in the air. Strange; different.<br />        The simple form 异 is 巳(已) yǐ phonetic over 廾 'two hands'. It is over two thousand years old (说文).<br />        異 is a component in 戴翼冀瀵 (in these characters 異 is not simplified to 异).}	different; unusual, strange			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B2%A7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">異的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B2A7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">異的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%BC%82"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">异在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%BC%82"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1797"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">異在RTK：uncommon</span></a>	RTH
1309	巷	巷	Lane	9	<i>Together ... snakeskin</i>.
