1312	井	井	a Well	4				jǐng	{"Primitively, it was designed to represent eight square lots of fields, divided among eight families, reserving the middle square for public use, and digging a well in it. The well is represented by a dot; 八家一井。象。Such was the custom in antiquity. See Textes Historiques, p. 25. The system was abolished, and the character is now used to mean, a well... phonetic in 刑 xíng" --Wieger.<br />        The dot is missing in the modern form.}	well, mine shaft, pit			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A4%AB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">井的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A4AB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">井的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BA%95"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">井在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1806"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">井在RTK：well</span></a>	RTH
1313	亞	亚	Asia	8				yà [普], yǎ [國]	{亚(F亞) [yà] inferior, second; 亚洲 Yàzhōu Asia<br />"Picture of a humpback." --Karlgren.<br />        "A 工 work deformed; ugly, as a hunchback. The vertical line is doubled, to show a deformation in different directions. The meaning SECOND, derived from 二, is jiǎjiè." --Wieger.<br />        Cognate with 恶 è, wù.<br />        The meaning "Asia" is from a phonetic loan: 亚细亚 Yàxìyà.<br />亞細亞[亚细亚] Yàxìyà p.w. 〈loan〉 Asia}	Asia, Asian; second			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A8%C8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">亞的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A8C8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">亞的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BA%9A"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">亚在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BA%9A"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1809"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">亞在RTK：asia（亜）</span></a>	RTH
1314	惡	恶	Evil	12	<i>Asia ... heart</i>. [12]		(<u>not</u> <i>malicious</i>)	è		evil, wicked, bad, foul			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B4c"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">惡的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B463"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">惡的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%81%B6"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">恶在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%81%B6"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1810"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">惡在RTK：bad（悪）</span></a>	RTH
1315	角	角	Angle	7	<i>Bound up ... glas cover ... soil</i>. [7]	<i>carpenter's square</i>	(horn)	jiǎo	{Picture of a horn.}	angle, corner; horn, horn-shaped			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A8%A4"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">角的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A8A4"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">角的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%A7%92"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">角在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1812"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">角在RTK：angle</span></a>	RTH
1316	解	解	to untie	13	<i>Carpenter's square ... dagger ... cow</i>. [13]			jiě	{解 [jiě] separate; explain&nbsp;&nbsp;[Xiè] (surname) [jiè] 解送<br />From 角 (jiǎo) 'horn', 刀 (dāo) 'knife', and 牛 (niú) 'ox'.<br />        "Cleave with a 刀 knife the 角 horn of 牛 an ox" --Karlgren.	to separate, divide; to loosen, untie			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B8%D1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">解的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B8D1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">解的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%A7%A3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">解在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1814"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">解在RTK：unravel</span></a>	RTH
1317	嘴	嘴	Orifice	16	<i>mouth ... this (literary) ... carpenter's square</i>. [16]			zuǐ	{嘴 [zuǐ] (嘴巴 zuǐba) mouth; 嘴唇 zuǐchún lip<br />Originally 觜, from 此 cǐ phonetic and 角 (jiǎo) 'horn'. The primitive meaning was a bird's beak, which resembles a horn. 口 (kǒu) 'mouth' was added to clarify the extended meaning, which is 'mouth'.<br />        An old variant character is 咀 zuǐ.}	mouth			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BCL"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">嘴的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BC4C"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">嘴的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%98%B4"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">嘴在n词酷</span></a>・	RTH
1318	再	再	once more	6	<i>Ceiling ... glass cover ... soil</i>. [6]			zài	{Supposed to represent a 巾 balance or scales, hanging from a 一 beam, with the number 二 two (2) superimposed (the lower two horizontal strokes).<br />        "A 二 second 巾 weighing, equal to the first one" --Wieger.<br />        Compare 两 liǎng. No relation to 冉 rǎn.}	once more, again, next (in sequence)			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A6A"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">再的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A641"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">再的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%86%8D"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">再在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1815"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">再在RTK：again</span></a>	RTH
1319	稱	称	to weigh	14	The top stroke of <i>once more</i> is replaced with a <i>vulture</i>. That, together with <i>wild rice</i> gives us <b>weigh</b>. [14]			chēng	{The left side is 禾 (hé) 'grain'. In the full form 稱, the right side is 爯: a 爫 hand holding 冉 scales, weighing the grain. In the simple form 称 the right side is 尔 ěr, like the right side of 你 nǐ. (称 is also the Japanese form.)<br />        Compare 秤 chèng 'balance', which is a cognate word.}	to weigh, estimate; to call, address			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BA%D9"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">稱的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BAD9"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">稱的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%A7%B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">称在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%A7%B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=905"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">稱在RTK：appellation（称）</span></a>	RTH
1320	講	讲	to lecture	17	<i>Words ... sieve</i>. [17]			jiǎng		to speak, discuss, explain; speech			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C1%BF"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">講的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C1BF"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">講的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%AE%B2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">讲在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%AE%B2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1816"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">講在RTK：lecture</span></a>	RTH
1321	構	构	to frame	14	<i>Tree ... sieve</i>. [14]			gòu	{The form 冓 seems to have originally depicted a pair of fish, face to face, meaning 'to meet' (now 遘 gòu).<br>        It came to be written 冓, like 井 over 再. 媾 gòu 'wedding, coitus' was the same word (people interlocking), the same character being enlarged by 女. 木 (mù) 'wood' was added for the meaning 'structure'. 沟 gōu 'ditches' and 篝 gōu 'bamboo frame' are cognate words.<br>        The simple form 构 replaces the right side with 勾 gòu. Don't confuse it with 枸 jǔ, gǒu.}	to construct, form; frame, structure			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BAc"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">構的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BA63"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">構的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%9E%84"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">构在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%9E%84"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1818"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">構在RTK：posture</span></a>	RTH
1322	扁	扁	flat	9	<i>Door ... tome</i>.	<i>book cover</i>		biǎn	{&quot;An 册 inscription hung over a 户 door... by extension, flat, those inscriptions being written upon a tablet.&quot; --Wieger.}	flat; tablet; inscription			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AB%F3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">扁的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=ABF3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">扁的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%89%81"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">扁在n词酷</span></a>・	RTH
1323	篇	篇	Piece of Writing	15	<i>Bamboo ... book cover</i>. [15]			piān	{From 竹 (zhú) 'bamboo' and 扁 biǎn ('flat') phonetic.<br />        In ancient times, 竹 bamboo strips were used for writing on. 扁 depicts a 册 (cè) document hung on a 户 (hù) door, so it is possible that 篇 piān and 扁 biǎn are cognate.<br />        Compare 编(編) biān 'weave; edit', which contains 纟(糸 sī) 'thread' (think of an editor as someone who weaves words, to avoid confusing 篇 piān and 编 biān).}	sheet, piece of writing, chapter, article			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BDg"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">篇的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BD67"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">篇的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%AF%87"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">篇在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2645"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">篇在RTK：livraison</span></a>	RTH
1324	編	编	to compile	15	<i>Thread ... book cover</i>. [15]			biān	{From 纟(糸 sī) 'thread' and 扁 biǎn ('flat') phonetic.<br />        An editor takes written materials and weaves them together. The fact that 编 biān contains 纟(糸 sī) 'thread' should help you distinguish it from 篇 piān 'piece of writing'.}	to arrange, edit, compile; knit			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BDs"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">編的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BD73"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">編的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%BC%96"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">编在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%BC%96"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1825"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">編在RTK：compilation</span></a>	RTH

1328	氏	氏	Family Name	4	<i>Eyedropper ... plow ... </i>a<i> one ... fishhook</i>. [4]			shì	{The modern form is similar to 民 mín 'people', but ancient forms were not so similar and the interpretations of both 氏 and 民 are very obscure.}	clan; maiden name			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A4%F3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">氏的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A4F3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">氏的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%B0%8F"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">氏在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1828"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">氏在RTK：family name</span></a>	RTH
1329	紙	纸	Paper	10	<i>Thread ... family name</i>. [10]			zhǐ	{From 纟(糸 sī) 'silk' and 氏 shì phonetic.<br />        In ancient times, silk cloth was used for writing on. It was nicer than writing on bamboo strips, which was the more economical alternative. Paper didn't become popular until the Tang dynasty (618-906).}	paper			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AF%C8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">紙的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=AFC8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">紙的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%BA%B8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">纸在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%BA%B8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1829"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">紙在RTK：paper</span></a>	RTH
1330	昏	昏	Dusk	8	<i>Family name ... sun</i>. [8]			hūn	{From 氏 (shì) over 日 (rì) 'sun'.<br />        "The seal has not 氏 but 氐 'bottom': the 日 sun 氐 down" --Karlgren.}	dusk, nightfall, twilight, dark			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A9%FC"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">昏的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A9FC"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">昏的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%98%8F"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">昏在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2451"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">昏在RTK：dusk</span></a>	RTH

1332	低	低	low	7	<i>Person ... calling card</i>. [7]			dī	{From 亻(人 rén) 'person' and 氐 dǐ 'foundation'. 低 dī 'low' is etymologically related to 氐 dǐ 'foundation' and 底 dǐ 'bottom'.}	low, beneath; to hang down, let droop			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A7C"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">低的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A743"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">低的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BD%8E"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">低在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1831"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">低在RTK：lower</span></a>	RTH
1333	底	底	Bottom	8	<i>Cave ... calling card</i>. [8]			dǐ	{From 广 'roof' and 氐 dǐ 'foundation'. 氐 is from 氏 shì phonetic, and a 丶 dot at the BOTTOM. 氐 was put under a 广 roof to emphasize what it ISN'T (the top). Compare 低 dī 'low', 抵 dǐ 'resist'.}	bottom, base; underside			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A9%B3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">底的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A9B3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">底的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%BA%95"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">底在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1833"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">底在RTK：bottom</span></a>	RTH

1340	都	都	Metropolis	11	<i>Puppet ... city walls</i>. [11]			dū	{From 者 zhě phonetic (compare 堵 dǔ, 赌 dǔ, etc.) and 阝(邑 yì) 'city'. 1343	鄉	乡	Countryside	12	<i>Floss ... young man</i>. [12]			xiāng	{The full form 鄉 originally depicted two people 乡 and 阝, sitting down at  a meal (part of 食 shí). The simple form 乡 is just the left hand side.<br />        Compare 即 jí 'immediately' (one person facing food), and 既 jì 'already' (person facing away from food).<br />        卿 qīng 'minister' was originally the same word and the same character as 乡(鄉) xiāng 'village'.}	country; village			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B6m"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">鄉的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B66D"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">鄉的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B9%A1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">乡在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B9%A1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1849"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">鄉在RTK：hometown（郷）</span></a>	RTH
1344	響	响	an Echo	21	<i>Countryside ... sound</i>. [21]			xiǎng	{The full form 響 is composed of 鄉 xiāng phonetic over 音 (yīn) 'sound'.<br />        The simple form 响 is completely different, composed of 口 (kǒu) 'mouth' and 向 xiàng phonetic. (It dates to the 明 dynasty, according to 李乐毅).}	make sound, make noise; sound			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C5T"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">響的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C554"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">響的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%93%8D"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">响在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%93%8D"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1850"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">響在RTK：echo</span></a>	RTH

1347	幻	幻	unreal	4	<i>Cocoon ... clothes hanger</i>. [4]			huàn	{"It is 予 yú inverted. To give things DIFFERING from those expected, or to give an EMPTY hand, to deceive, to frustrate. The frustration of the beggar's hopes is graphically represented by 予 inverted. 相诈惑也。从倒予, 指事。The modern abbreviation is absurd. Not to be confounded with 幼 yòu" --Wieger (幼 yòu means "immature").<br />        "Does not really contain 幺 but the seal is an independent symbol of uncertain analysis" --Karlgren(1923).}	fantasy, illusion, mirage			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A4%DB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">幻的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A4DB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">幻的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%B9%BB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">幻在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1862"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">幻在RTK：phantasm</span></a>	RTH

1351	船	船	Ship	11	<i>Boat ... belch</i>. [11]			chuán	{From 舟 (zhōu) 'boat' and  yǎn phonetic.  'marsh between hills' also suggests the meaning, describing (like 谷 gǔ 'valley') a hollow place, like a hollowed out boat.<br />        Not to be confused with 般 bān 'sort'.}	a boat; vessel; ship			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B2%EE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">船的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B2EE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">船的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%88%B9"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">船在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1874"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">船在RTK：ship</span></a>	leech RTH
1352	般	般	the Sort	10	<i>Boat ... missile</i>. [10]			bān	{From 舟 (zhōu) 'boat' and 殳 (shū) 'beat'.<br />        To 殳 (beat:) propel a 舟 boat --&gt; distribute --&gt; category. The old meaning 'transport' is now 搬 bān, with 扌(手 shǒu) 'hand' added. Don't confuse with 船 chuán 'boat', which has 叴 not 殳.}	sort; kind; class			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AF%EB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">般的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=AFEB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">般的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%88%AC"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">般在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1871"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">般在RTK：carrier</span></a>	RTH

1357	益	益	a Benefit	10	<i>(snowflake</i> on a side<i>)/(sparkler ... one)/(horns ... animal legs) ... dish</i>. [10]			yì	{From 水 (shuǐ) 'water' turned sideways (it looks just like ☵ Kǎn in the seal character), over 皿 (mǐn) 'dish'.<br />        "It represents a 皿 vase, so full of 水 water, that it overflows. This circumstance is represented by the fact that 水 is over the vase and is bent down, thus expressing its overflowing. By extension, addition, profit, excess, overplus." --Wieger.}	benefit, increase			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AFq"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">益的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=AF71"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">益的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%9B%8A"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">益在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1881"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">益在RTK：benefit</span></a>	RTH
1358	假	假	Vacation	11	<i>Person ... braces</i>. [11]			jià	{Originally 叚 was 二 (èr) 'two' plus 皮 (pí) 'skin': 二 second (false) 皮 skin. 亻(人 rén) 'person' was added later.<br />        Not to be confused with 段 duàn 'section'.}	vacation			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B0%B2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">假的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B0B2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">假的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%81%87"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">假在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=966"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">假在RTK：provisional（仮）</span></a>	RTH
1359	蝦	虾	Shrimp	15	<i>Insect ... braces</i>. [15]			xiā		shrimp, prawn			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BD%BC"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">蝦的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BDBC"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">蝦的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%99%BE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">虾在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%99%BE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2689"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">蝦在RTK：shrimp</span></a>	RTH
1360	氣	气	Air	10				qì	{"Curling vapours rising from the ground and forming clouds above" --Wieger.<br />        The full form 氣 has 米 (mǐ) 'rice' added: 气 steam rising from 米 rice as it cooks.}	steam, gas, air; "qi"			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AE%F0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">氣的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=AEF0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">氣的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%B0%94"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">气在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%B0%94"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1885"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">氣在RTK：spirit（気）</span></a>	RTH
1361	汽	汽	Vapor	7			(<u>not</u> <i>Air</i>)	qì	{汽 qì is etymologically the same word as 气(氣) qì 'air, vapor, vital energy', specifyingly enlarged by 氵(水 shuǐ) 'water'.}	steam, vapor			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A8T"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">汽的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A854"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">汽的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%B1%BD"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">汽在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1886"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">汽在RTK：vapor</span></a>	RTH
1362	飛	飞	to fly	9	Two large <i>hooks</i> have little propellers (two <i>drops</i>); beneath is the liter which serves as the fuel tank			fēi	{"It represents a crane (very common in China) seen from behind. Upwards, the head and the neck bent up, as when the cranes are flying. Below, the tail. On both sides, the wings fluttering. The small strokes represent the quills separated when the bird is flying" --Wieger.<br />        Compare 卂 (迅, 讯 xùn) which is the same bird without "quills".}	to fly			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AD%B8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">飛的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=ADB8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">飛的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%A3%9E"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">飞在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%A3%9E"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1887"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">飛在RTK：fly</span></a>	RTH
1363	面	面	face-to-face	9				miàn	{From 𦣻(首 shǒu) 'head', with the face circled.}}	face; surface; plane; side, dimension			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AD%B1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">面的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=ADB1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">面的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%9D%A2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">面在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1892"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">面在RTK：mask</span></a>	RTH
1364	麵	面	Noodles	20	<i>Wheat ... face-to-face</i>. [20]			miàn	{        The full form character for miàn 'noodle' is 麵, from 麥 (mài) 'wheat' and 面 miàn phonetic. A variant form is 麪, with 丏 miàn phonetic. Among simple form characters, 面 is used in place of 麵 or 麪.<br /><br />&quot;This character is considered by some philologists as a derivative of 正. This is a mistake. It is a primitive, representing a woman sitting; 一 is the girdle; on the left, the seat; on the right, an apron that hides the fore and lower part of the body. By extension, to conceal, to hide, retreat, confinement, screened, out of view&quot; --Wieger.<br />        No relation to 丐 gài.}	flour, dough, noodles			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C4%D1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">麵的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C4D1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">麵的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%9D%A2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">面在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%9D%A2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・	RTH
1365	革	革	Leather	9				gé	{&quot;Hide, skin; to flay, take off; deprive of -- picture of a skin split open, a hide seen from the back, with legs apart&quot; --Karlgren.<br />        The extended meaning of 'revolution' may refer to the way a rejected leader has his leadership stripped away like a dead sheep's hide.}	leather, animal hide			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AD%B2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">革的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=ADB2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">革的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%9D%A9"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">革在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1893"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">革在RTK：leather</span></a>	RTH

1368	聲	声	Voice	17	<i>Civil war ... ear</i>. [17]			shēng	{Picture of a musical instrument, chimes made of stone, hanging from a frame. The full form 聲, has on the right of 声, 殳 (shū) 'beat' (a hand holding a mallet), and below, 耳 (ěr) 'ear'. These stone-age chimes are called 磬 qìng.<br />        The use of 声 instead of 聲 dates back at least 800 years.}	sound, tone; voice			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C1n"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">聲的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C16E"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">聲的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%A3%B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">声在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%A3%B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1896"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">聲在RTK：voice（声）</span></a>	RTH

1373	蒸	蒸	to steam	13				zhēng	{Originally written 烝, from 丞 chéng 'assistant' phonetic and 灬 (火 huǒ) 'fire'. 艹(草 cǎo) 'plant', which was added later, might represent the wood used as fuel, or vegetables being steamed.<br />        &quot;Firewood, to smoke, to steam; rise; all&quot; --Karlgren(1923).<br />        The older character 烝 is now used in the extended sense 'multitude'.}	to steam			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BB]"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">蒸的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BB5D"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">蒸的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%92%B8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">蒸在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1900"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">蒸在RTK：steam</span></a>	leech RTH

1385	為	为	to act	9				wèi	{An elephant and a hand guiding it.<br />        Pronounced wèi when it means 'on account of', and in the words 为了 wèile, 为着 wèizhe, 为什么 wèishenme, and 因为 yīnwèi. Otherwise pronounced wéi.<br />        The old form 爲 is still used almost as much as the "full" form 為.}	to do, handle, govern, act; because of			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AC%B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">為的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=ACB0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">為的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%BA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">为在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%BA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1918"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">為在RTK：do</span></a>	RTH

1390	套	套	a Cover	10	<i>St.Bernard dog ... long</i>. 1391	髮	发	Hair of the Head	15				fà [普], fǎ [國]	{The full form 髮 is 髟 biāo 'hair' (長 long 彡 hair) on top of 犮 (the right side of 拔 bá) phonetic (which is unrelated to 发). The similarity between 拔 and 发 is coincidental. Anyway, there is a single simple form: 发 fā 'emit', fà 'hair'.}	hair			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BEv"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">髮的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BE76"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">髮的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%8F%91"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">发在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%8F%91"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1924"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">髮在RTK：hair of the head（髪）</span></a>	RTH

1393	喪	丧	Funeral	12	<i>Soil ... chatterbox ... barrette</i>. [12]			sàng	{Originally from 哭 (kū) 'cry', over 亡 (wáng) 'die':<br />        "To 哭 cry, weep (the place of the 口 mouths slightly varied) over a 亡 dead person; badly disfigured in the modern form" --Karlgren.<br />        The two 口 mouths become 丷 two dots in the simple form.}	to lose (by death), mourn; mourning; funeral			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B3%E0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">喪的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B3E0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">喪的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%A7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">丧在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%A7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1926"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">喪在RTK：miss</span></a>	RTH
1394	雁	雁	Wild Goose	12	<i>Cliff ... birdman</i>. [12]			yàn	{From 厂, 亻(人 rén) 'person' and 隹 (zhuī) 'bird'.<br />        "Interpretation of character uncertain" --Karlgren.<br />        The top is 厂, not 广; compare 应(應) yīng, 鹰(鷹) yīng.}	wild goose			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B6%AD"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">雁的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B6AD"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">雁的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%9B%81"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">雁在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2150"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">雁在RTK：wild goose</span></a>	RTH
1395	應	应	ought to	17	<i>Cave ... birdman ... heart</i>. [17]			yīng	{The full form 應 is composed of 鷹 yīng ('eagle') phonetic (minus 鳥) and 心 (xīn) 'heart' signific. The simple form 应 has 倠 and 心 replaced by a four-stroke rough outline.}	should, ought to, must			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C0%B3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">應的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C0B3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">應的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%BA%94"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">应在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%BA%94"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=607"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">應在RTK：apply（応）</span></a>	RTH

1397	鷹	鹰	Hawk	24	<i>Cave ... birdman ... bird</i>. [24]			yīng	{From 广 (guǎng) 'house', 亻(人 rén) 'person', 隹 (zhuī) 'bird', and 鸟(鳥 niǎo) 'bird'.<br />        "The 隹 bird used (for hunting) by 人 man and kept in his 广 house... character tautologically enlarged by 鳥" --Karlgren.}	hawk; falcon; eagle			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C6N"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">鷹的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C64E"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">鷹的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%B9%B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">鹰在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%B9%B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2237"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">鷹在RTK：hawk</span></a>	RTH

1399	島	岛	Island	10	The <i>bird's tail</i> is tucked under here, because it has come to stop on a <i>mountain</i> to rest from its journey across the waters. Thus the character comes to mean an <b>island</b>. [10]			dǎo	{From 山 (shān) 'mountain' and 鸟(鳥) niǎo ('bird') phonetic.<br />        山 takes the place of the last stroke of 鸟, or the last four strokes of 鳥.}	island			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AEq"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">島的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=AE71"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">島的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%B2%9B"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">岛在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%B2%9B"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1948"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">島在RTK：island</span></a>	RTH
1400	遇	遇	to encounter	12	<i>Talking Cricket ... road</i>. [12]			yù		to meet with; encounter			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B9J"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">遇的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B94A"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">遇的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%81%87"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">遇在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1956"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">遇在RTK：interview</span></a>	RTH
1401	萬	万	ten thousand	13	<i>Flowers ... Talking Cricket</i>. [13]	<i>Great Wall of China</i>		wàn	{The full form 萬 is a picture of a scorpion (claws at the top). It was borrowed for the word wàn 'ten thousand' which happened to sound like an ancient word for scorpion.<br />        The simple form 万 is at least as old as the Hàn dynasty. 万 could be a simplification of 萬, or it might just be 一 (yī) 'one' over 人 (rén) 'person'; compare 千 (qiān) 'thousand'.<br />        万 is pronounced Mò in the surname 万俟 Mòqí.}	ten thousand; a great number; innumerable			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B8U"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">萬的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B855"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">萬的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%87"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">万在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%87"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2969"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">萬在RTK：ten thousand [old]</span></a>	RTH leech
1402	邁	迈	to stride	16	<i>Great Wall of China ... road</i>. [16]			mài	{From 万(萬 wàn) 'ten thousand' and 辶(辵 chuò) 'go'.<br />        "March, make a journey, go to; surpass, pass by -- 萬 many 辵 steps" --Karlgren.}	to take a step; a big stride			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C1%DA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">邁的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C1DA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">邁的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%BF%88"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">迈在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%BF%88"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2970"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">邁在RTK：pass through</span></a>	leech RTH

1410	逸	逸	to flee	11	<i>Rabbit ... road</i>. 1417	罵	骂	to scold	15	<i>Net ... horse</i>. [15]			mà	{The bottom is 马(馬) mǎ phonetic.<br>        The top of 罵 is 罒, originally 网 (wǎng) 'net'.<br>        The forms 駡 and 骂 have 吅, which is 口 (kǒu) 'mouth' doubled.<br>        The meaning is to reprimand (with the 口 mouth!) someone caught (with a 网 net!) for some offence (compare 罚 fá 'punish', and the old word 詈 lì 'curse').}	to scold; to curse, blame			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BD|"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">罵的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BD7C"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">罵的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%AA%82"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">骂在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%AA%82"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2699"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">罵在RTK：insult</span></a>	RTH

1424	處	处	Location	11	<i>Tiger ... walking legs ... wind</i>. [11]			chù	{Originally 処, from 夂 (zhǐ) 'walk slowly' and 几 (jī) 'small table':<br />        "Where you 夂 go and 几 sit down" --Karlgren.<br />        Somebody put 虍(虎 hǔ) 'tiger' on top of it all for no known reason, making the full form 處. In the simple form the 几 chair was discarded, along with all of the 虍 tiger except its 卜... head?}	location, place, spot; bureau, department			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B3B"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">處的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B342"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">處的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%A4%84"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">处在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%A4%84"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=297"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">處在RTK：dispose（処）</span></a>	RTH
1425	戲	戏	to frolic	17	<i>Tiger ... beans ... fiesta</i>. [17]			xì	{戲(S戏) [xì] (戲劇 xìjù) drama, play; 游戲 yóuxì game<br />The left side of the full form 戲 is 虍 tiger over 豆 vase, an obsolete character (&quot;sacrificial vessel -- a 豆 vase with 虍 tiger shape or ornaments&quot; --Karlgren), used as a phonetic in 戲 xì.<br />        In the simple form 戏, the left side is 又 (yòu) 'hand'.}	theatrical play, show			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C0%B8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">戲的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C0B8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">戲的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%88%8F"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">戏在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%88%8F"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1994"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">戲在RTK：frolic（戯）</span></a>	leech RTH
1426	劇	剧	Drama	15	<i>Tiger ... sow ... saber</i>. [15]			jù	{(Karlgren says 豦 was co-signific in 劇: &quot;Painful, intense; very; sport -- 豦 fight and 刀 sword&quot;.)<br />==== 豦 [jù] (wild boar -- obsolete; component in 據 etc.)}	drama; play; show			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BC@"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">劇的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BC40"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">劇的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%89%A7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">剧在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%89%A7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1997"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">劇在RTK：drama</span></a>	RTH

[16]			jù	{==== 豦 [jù] (wild boar -- obsolete; component in 據 etc.)}	according to; to act in accordance with			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BE%DA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">據的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BEDA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">據的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%8D%AE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">据在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%8D%AE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1064"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">據在RTK：set（据）</span></a>	RTH
1428	鹿	鹿	Deer	11		When <u>not</u> abbreviated the image is <i>painting of a deer</i>		lù		deer			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B3%C0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">鹿的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B3C0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">鹿的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%B9%BF"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">鹿在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1999"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">鹿在RTK：deer</span></a>	RTH
1429	塵	尘	Dust	14	<i>Deer ... soil</i>. [14]			chén	{The full form 塵 is 鹿 (lù) 'deer' over 土 (tǔ) 'dirt', and in the seal there were three 鹿 deer:<br />        "The 土 dust cloud after running deer" --Karlgren(1923).<br />        The simple form 尘 has 小 (xiǎo) 'small' in place of 鹿. It is NOT the same as 尖 jiān 'tip'. The form 尘 dates to the 17th century.}	dust; ashes, dirt, earth			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B9%D0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">塵的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B9D0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">塵的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%B0%98"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">尘在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%B0%98"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2838"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">塵在RTK：dust</span></a>	RTH
1430	麗	丽	lovely	19	Two <i>ordinary</i> drawings on two patches of <i>ceiling</i> above<i> ... painting of a deer</i>. [19]			lì	{Picture of a deer's antlers. In the full form 麗 the entire 鹿 (lù) deer is shown. In the simple form 丽 only the antlers are shown, and the top is a single stroke.}	beautiful, elegant			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C4R"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">麗的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C452"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">麗的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%BD"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">丽在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%BD"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2002"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">麗在RTK：lovely</span></a>	RTH
1431	熊	熊	Bear	14	<i>Elbow ... flesh ... spoon </i>atop a<i> spoon ... cooking fire</i>. [14]			xióng	{From 能 (néng) 'bear' and 灬 (火 huǒ) 'fire'. 能 depicted a bear; now it is used for the word néng 'able'. Whether the added 灬 four dots depict the bear's feet, or 火 fire cooking bear meat, is uncertain.}	bear; to scold, rebuke			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BA%B5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">熊的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BAB5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">熊的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%86%8A"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">熊在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2003"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">熊在RTK：bear</span></a>	RTH

1433	態	态	Attitude	14	<i>Ability ... heart</i>. [14]			tài		attitude, manner, bearing,			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BAA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">態的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BA41"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">態的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%80%81"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">态在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%80%81"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2005"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">態在RTK：attitude</span></a>	RTH
1434	寅	寅	Sign Of The Tiger	11	<i>House ... ceiling ... sprout ... animal legs</i>. [11]			yín	{寅 [yín] the third 地支 Earthly Branch<br />&quot;Behaviour, gait, ritual politeness; 居敬也。In a 宀 house, a man [一 over 人] (a special primitive, stiff bearing, on the top, a cap) pays salutations with both hands. The modern character is a contraction&quot; --Wieger.<br />        The oldest forms appear to depict two hands holding an arrow; according to Henshall the meaning was &quot;straighten an arrow&quot;; it was borrowed for the third Earthly Branch.}	3rd Earthly Branch; TIGER; [3:00am - 5:00am]; to respect, reverence			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B1G"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">寅的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B147"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">寅的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%AF%85"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">寅在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2006"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">寅在RTK：sign of the tiger</span></a>	RTH
1435	演	演	to perform	14	<i>Water ... sign of the tiger</i>. [14]			yǎn	{Why 氵(水) water? 演 yǎn also means 'evolve', and used to mean 'wide, extensive'. It originally described a river getting wider and extending towards the sea.}	to practice, perform;&nbsp;&nbsp;to act			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BAt"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">演的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BA74"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">演的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%BC%94"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">演在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2007"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">演在RTK：performance</span></a>	RTH
1436	辰	辰	Sign Of The Dragon	7	<i>cliff ... two ... barrettes</i>. [7]			chén	{辰 [chén] 5th of 12 Earthly Branches (地支); 2-hr period; 星辰 star<br />辰 may have depicted an ancient kind of hoe.<br />        &quot;The 5th of the duodecimal cycle of time-reckoning characters, 7-9 A.M.; a double hour; (time-marker:) heavenly body&quot; --Karlgren.}	5th Earthly Branch; DRAGON; [7:00am - 9:00am]; heavenly body, early morning			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A8%B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">辰的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A8B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">辰的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%BE%B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">辰在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2008"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">辰在RTK：sign of the dragon</span></a>	RTH
1437	晨	晨	Morning	11	<i>Sun ... sign of the dragon</i>. [11]			chén	{From 日 (rì) 'sun' and 辰 chén, which is the name of the two-hour period between 7 and 9 in the morning.<br />        晨 chén is etymologically the same word as 辰 chén, written with 日 'sun' added for emphasis.}	morning; dawn, daybreak			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B1%E1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">晨的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B1E1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">晨的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%99%A8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">晨在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2443"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">晨在RTK：morrow</span></a>	RTH
1438	農	农	Agriculture	13	<i>Bent ... sign of the dragon</i>. [13]		(full character, "husbandry", сельхозработы: колхоз)	nóng	{"The husbandman; 耕人也。A 囟 head, two  hands, and 晨 the break of day contracted, 日 giving place to 囟. The man who works from early dawn; all field-work being done very early in hot countries 耕作必于晨" --Wieger.<br />         Don't confuse the simple form 农 with 衣 yī 'clothing'.}	agriculture, farming			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B9A"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">農的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B941"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">農的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%86%9C"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">农在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%86%9C"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2014"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">農在RTK：agriculture</span></a>	RTH

1440	送	送	to deliver	9	<i>Golden calf ... road</i>. [9]			sòng	{送 [sòng] see somebody off; deliver; give<br />From 关 and 辶(辵 chuò) 'go'.<br />        关 in 送 was  two hands with a 火 (huǒ) torch, nothing to do with 关(關) guān. 1444	龍	龙	Dragon	16				lóng	{"The dragon. When it ascends to heaven and flies, it rains; when it hides in the wells, there is a drought. 1445	襲	袭	to raid	22	<i>Dragon ... clothing</i>. [22]			xí	{襲(S袭) [xí] make a surprise attack; carry on as before<br />From 龙(龍 lóng) 'dragon' over 衣 (yī) 'clothing'.<br />        &quot;Court dress; lined garment, double; repeated; hereditary, inherit -- an 龍 (imperial) court 衣 dress&quot; --Karlgren.}	raid, attack; inherit			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C5%A7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">襲的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C5A7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">襲的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%A2%AD"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">袭在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%A2%AD"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2025"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">襲在RTK：attack</span></a>	RTH
1446	兒	儿	Youngster	8	<i>Mortar ... human legs</i>. [8]			ér	{儿 is now used as the simplifed form of 兒 ér 'child', whose full form 兒 has 臼 (jiù) for a head.<br />        "An infant; 孺子也, 从儿, 从囟, 會意。儿古文人像, 囟小兒頭。A 儿 body and a 囟 head opened in the form of 臼, representing a skull, the fontanels of which are not yet closed" --Wieger.}	son, child			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A8%E0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">兒的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A8E0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">兒的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%84%BF"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">儿在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%84%BF"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=58"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">兒在RTK：newborn babe（児）</span></a>	RTH
1447	舊	旧	old	18	<i>Flowers ... turkey ... mortar</i>. [18]		(&quot;ancient&quot;, <u>not</u> <i>old man</i>)	jiù	{The full form 舊 is 艹 over 隹 over 臼. The original meaning was 'owl': a 隹 (zhuī) bird with 艹 feather-horns (really 雈, slightly different on top from 萑). 臼 jiù ('mortar') is phonetic. The character was borrowed for the word jiù 'old' which happened to sound the same.<br />        臼 jiù is difficult to write well in a hurry, so in handwriting it can come out like 丨 plus 日. Then for the simple form 旧, 艹 and 隹 were dropped altogether from 舊. (臼 jiù meaning 'mortar' retains its full form.)}	old (opposite of new); ancient, former, past			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C2%C2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">舊的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C2C2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">舊的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%97%A7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">旧在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%97%A7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=35"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">舊在RTK：olden times（旧）</span></a>	RTH
1448	寫	写	to write	15	<i>House ... mortar ... bound up ... fire</i>. [15]			xiě	{The full form 寫 is 宀 (mián) 'roof' over 舄 xì phonetic. One generally writes 宀 indoors; compare 字 zì.}	to write, compose; to draw, sketch			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BCg"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">寫的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BC67"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">寫的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%86%99"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">写在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%86%99"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1247"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">寫在RTK：copy（写）</span></a>	RTH
1449	瀉	泻	Diarrhea	18	<i>Water ... write</i>. [18]			xiè	{From 氵(水 shuǐ) 'water' and 写(寫) xiě.<br />        According to Karlgren, 泻 xiè and 写 xiě are cognate words, the original meaning being 'dissipate, disburden'.}	to flow (out) swiftly, leak; diarrhea			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C2m"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">瀉的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C26D"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">瀉的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%B3%BB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">泻在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%B3%BB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・	RTH
1450	兩	两	dos	8		yoke	("two")	liǎng	{兩(S两) [liǎng] two; 50 grams<br />"Picture of a balance, two arms with a weight on each" --Karlgren.<br />        Interestingly, the picture fits both meanings ('two' and 'fifty grams'), even though the meanings seem totally unrelated.}	two, both, pair, couple			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A8%E2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">兩的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A8E2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">兩的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%A4"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">两在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%A4"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1168"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">兩在RTK：both（両）</span></a>	RTH
1451	倆	俩	Duo	10	<i>Person ... yoke</i>. [10]			liǎ	{倆(S俩) [liǎng] [liǎ] two, both; 我們倆 the two of us<br />From 亻(人 rén) 'person' and 两(兩) liǎng 'two'.}	two; both			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AD%C7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">倆的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=ADC7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">倆的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BF%A9"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">俩在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BF%A9"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・	RTH
1452	滿	满	full	14	<i>Water ... twenty ... yoke</i>. [14]			mǎn		full, filled, satisfied; Manchurian			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BA%A1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">滿的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BAA1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">滿的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%BB%A1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">满在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%BB%A1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1169"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">滿在RTK：full（満）</span></a>	RTH leech
1453	爾	尔	you&nbsp;&nbsp;[literary]	14	<i>Tool ... towel ... stitching</i>. [14]			ěr	{Which came first, 尔 or 爾?<br />        Wieger cites this explanation for 尔:<br />                “从入丨八, 会意。八者气之分也。”<br />Then 爾 came from 尔 (phonetic), 巾 ( = 两 a balance) and 爻爻 weights on both sides, to give the meaning &quot;symmetry, harmony of proportions&quot;.<br />        Karlgren(1923) says of the form 爾, &quot;...original sense and hence explanation of character uncertain&quot;, and considers 尔 an abbreviation.<br />        The pronunciation was once something like nzie. This produced both ěr and nǐ, the latter written 你 nǐ, which is the modern word for 'you'. Now 尔 is only used in a few adverbs and archaic expressions, and in foreign loan words.}	thou; that, those			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BA%B8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">爾的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BAB8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">爾的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%B0%94"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">尔在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%B0%94"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2074"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">爾在RTK：let it be</span></a>	RTH
1454	彌	弥	to fill	17	<i>bow ... you (literary)</i>. [17]		(<u>not</u> <i>full</i>)	mí		full; to fill			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C0%B1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">彌的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C0B1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">彌的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%BC%A5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">弥在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%BC%A5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2241"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">彌在RTK：more and more（弥）</span></a>	RTH
1455	虛	虚	false	12	<i>Tigers ... saguaro cactus</i>. [12]			xū	{虛[虚] ⁴xū s.v. ①empty; unoccupied ②diffident; timid ③weak; in poor health ◆b.f. ①false; faked xūwěi ②nominal xūshè ③humble; modest qiānxū ④virtual xūxiàng ⑤guiding principles; theory ¹wùxū yǐxūdàishí ◆n. ①void; emptiness ②11th of the 28 constellations ◆adv. in vain<br /><br />虍 hǔ (虎 'tiger') is phonetic. The bottom is from an old form of 丘 (qiū) 'hill', signific. In the full form 虛, the bottom has six strokes; in the simple form 虚, the bottom is 业 (yè), five strokes.<br />        &quot;A high upland; 大丘也。从丘, 虍声。These uplands being generally wild and barren, hence 转注 zhuǎnzhù, empty, that which contains nothing; 大丘空旷, 故虚閑也, 空也。&quot; --Wieger.}	false; empty, vain			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B5%EA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">虛的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B5EA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">虛的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%99%9A"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">虚在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%99%9A"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1993"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">虛在RTK：void（虚）</span></a>	RTH
1456	聯	联	to unite	17	<i>Ear ... cactus fruit</i>. [17]			lián	{From 耳 (ěr) 'ear' and 关(𢇇). The similarity to 关(𢇇關) guān is accidental.<br />        &quot;The seal has 絲 to the right, corrupted in the modern form: to string together 耳 the ears of slain enemies.&quot; --Karlgren.}	to ally, unite, join			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C1p"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">聯的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C170"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">聯的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%81%94"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">联在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%81%94"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2676"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">聯在RTK：strung together</span></a>	RTH
1457	關	关	to shut	19	<i>Gate ... cactus fruit</i>. [19]			guān	{The full form 關 has 門 (mén) 'door' to indicate the meaning and numerous strokes inside (threads being woven -- once a phonetic component).}	to close, shut; to turn off			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C3%F6"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">關的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C3F6"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">關的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%85%B3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">关在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%85%B3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2017"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">關在RTK：connection（関）</span></a>	RTH
1458	那	那	that	7		Alcatraz		nà	{From 冉 (rǎn) 'fur' and 阝(邑 yì) 'city'. 那 Nà was once the name of a city. The character 那 was borrowed (as a phonetic loan) for the word nà 'that'.}	that, that one, those			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A8%BA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">那的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A8BA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">那的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%82%A3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">那在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2960"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">那在RTK：interrogative</span></a>	RTH
1459	哪	哪	which?	10				nǎ	{From 口 (kǒu) 'mouth' and 那 nà 'that'.<br />        In old-fashioned writing, sometimes 哪 is written 那, without 口, so that one has to guess from context whether it is nǎ 'what' or nà 'that'.}	which; how			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%AD%FE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">哪的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=ADFE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">哪的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%93%AA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">哪在n词酷</span></a>・	RTH
1460	巫	巫	Witch	7	<i>I-beam ... assembly line</i>. [7]			wū [普], wú [國]	{巫 [wū] (巫婆 wūpó) witch, sorceress; shaman; wizard; (surname)<br />From 工 (gōng) 'work' and 人 (rén) 'person' doubled.<br />        "The 工 work of 从 witches; magic, incantations. Two witches who dance to obtain rain. 祝也。女能以舞降神者也。象。从工, 两人舞形。" --Wieger.<br />        巫 is a signific component in 筮 shì and 靈(灵) líng.}	witch			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A7%C5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">巫的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A7C5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">巫的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%B7%AB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">巫在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2930"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">巫在RTK：sorceress</span></a>	RTH
1461	靈	灵	Spirit	24	The three <i>mouths</i> indicate three <i>witches</i> who are invoking the weather <b>spirits</b> to send <i>rain</i>. [24]			líng	{The full form 靈 is 霝 líng over 巫 (wū) 'sorceress'. 霝 is 雨 (yǔ) 'rain' over 口口口 three raindrops. 霝 is a variant form of 零 líng with its original meaning of 'raindrop'; it is phonetic in 靈. At the same time 霝 'raindrop' suggests the meaning of 靈 'spirit', since 巫 sorceresses dance to call on the spirits to make rain.<br />        The simple form 灵, composed of 彐 over 火 (huǒ) 'fire', dates back at least to the Song dynasty. It meant 'slightly warm'; it was borrowed as a substitute for 靈, both characters being pronounced líng.}	spirit, soul; spiritual world			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C6F"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">靈的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C646"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">靈的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%81%B5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">灵在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%81%B5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1791"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">靈在RTK：spirits（霊）</span></a>	RTH
1462	縣	县	County	16	<i>nano-wrench ... yarn</i>			xiàn	{Picture of a 首 (shǒu) head hanging upside down on a rope tied to a tree. The tree disappeared thousands of years ago, and the 系 (xì) rope has disappeared from the simple form 县.<br />        &quot;To 系 bind, hang up 首 the head (inverted) of a criminal... suspend, hang up; ... (appendix, i.e.) subprefecture, district; sub-prefect, district-magistrate&quot; --Karlgren.<br />        Now 悬(懸) xuán means 'hang'.}	a district; county			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BF%A4"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">縣的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BFA4"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">縣的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%8E%BF"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">县在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%8E%BF"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=513"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">縣在RTK：prefecture（県）</span></a>	RTH
1463	懸	悬	to suspend	20	<i>County ... heart</i>. [20]		(hang (not 掛))	xuán	{From 县(縣) xiàn ('county') over 心 (xīn) 'heart'.<br />        县(縣) originally meant 'hang'; it depicted a person's head hanging upside down from a rope on a tree; now it is pronounced xiàn and means 'county'. 心 (xīn) 'heart' was added to the character to convey the extended meaning 'worry', and now 悬(懸) with 心 (xīn) 'heart' added is also used for the basic meaning 'hang'.}	to hang, suspend			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C4a"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">懸的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C461"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">懸的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%82%AC"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">悬在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%82%AC"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1394"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">懸在RTK：suspend</span></a>	RTH
1464	與	与	to offer	14				yǔ	{與(S与) [yǔ] and <br />與[与] ¹yǔ* b.f. ①give; offer zèngyǔ ②commend; support; assist yǔrénwéishàn ③get along with ³yìyǔ ④wait ◆cov. with; to ◆conj. and; together with<br /><br />The full form 與 was made by adding 舁 yú 'lift' (two pairs of hands) to 与. 舁 yú was phonetic; two pairs of hands also could depict the giver and the receiver.<br />        Compare 兴(興) xìng (the full forms are similar).}	to give, grant; together with			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BBP"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">與的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BB50"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">與的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%8E"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">与在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%8E"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1246"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">與在RTK：bestow（与）</span></a>	RTH leech
1465	舉	举	to lift up	17	<i>Offer ... cornstalk</i>. [17]			jǔ		to lift, hold up, raise; to cite			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C1|"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">舉的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C17C"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">舉的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%BE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">举在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%BE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1938"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">舉在RTK：raise（挙）</span></a>	RTH
1466	腦	脑	Brain	13	<i>Part of the body ... stream ... Farmer's Almanac (fontanel)</i>. [13]		(full character)	nǎo	{Originally : 巛 hair over 囟 head; then 月(肉 ròu) 'flesh' was added, giving the full form 腦. The right side is 㐫 in the simple form 脑. Compare 恼(惱) nǎo (as in 恼火 nǎohuǒ 'irritated').}	brain			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B8%A3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">腦的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B8A3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">腦的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%84%91"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">脑在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%84%91"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1934"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">腦在RTK：brain（脳）</span></a>	RTH
1467	惱	恼	Annoyed	12	<i>State of mind ... stream ... Farmer's Almanac (fontanel)</i>. [12]			nǎo	{From 忄(心 xīn) 'heart' and 㐫() nǎo 'brain'.<br />        When angry (恼火 nǎohuǒ), the 心 heart and 脑 brain seem to be on 火 fire.}	to get mad; vexed			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B4o"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">惱的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B46F"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">惱的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%81%BC"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">恼在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%81%BC"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1935"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">惱在RTK：trouble（悩）</span></a>	RTH
1468	專	专	Specialty	11	<i>Oriental ladybug ... glue</i>. [11]			zhuān	{ depicts a yoked 牛 (niú) ox. A 寸 (cùn) hand was added, leading the ox.
