1471	團	团	Troupe	14	<i>Pent in ... specialty</i>. [14]			tuán	{From 囗 (wéi) 'circle' and 專 zhuān phonetic.<br />        In the simple form 团, 專 is replaced by 才 (cái).<br />        Note: the simple form of 專 zhuān is 专, but here in 团(團), 專 is replaced by 才.}	group, regiment, troupe			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B9%CE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">團的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B9CE"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">團的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%9B%A2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">团在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%9B%A2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=582"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">團在RTK：group（団）</span></a>	RTH
1472	黃	黄	yellow	12	twenty replacing house in sign of the tiger			huáng	{The oldest forms seem to depict either 大 (dà) a person, or 矢 (shǐ) an arrow, with something around the waist, or shaft. There have been numerous changes and re-interpretations (involving 田 tián 'field', 火 huǒ 'fire' etc.).<br />        According to 郭沫若, 黄 depicted jade ornaments worn around the waist (玉佩). See 璜 huáng and 珩 héng.}	yellow			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B6%C0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">黃的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B6C0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">黃的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%BB%84"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">黄在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%BB%84"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1750"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">黃在RTK：yellow（黄）</span></a>	RTH
1473	廣	广	extensive	15	<i>Cave ... yellow</i>. 1475	窗	窗	Window	12	<i>Hole ... GPS(chimney)</i>. [12]			chuāng	{From 穴 (xué) 'hole' over 囱 (烟囱 yāncōng 'chimney'), picture of a window.}	window; shutter			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B5%A1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">窗的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B5A1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">窗的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%AA%97"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">窗在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=749"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">窗在RTK：window（窓）</span></a>	RTH
1476	總	总	general	17	<i>Silk ... GPS(chimney) ... heart</i>. [17]		(overall, general, <u>not</u> <i>a General</i>)	zǒng	{The full form 總 is 糸 (sī) 'thread' (tie up; collect; summarize) plus 悤 cōng phonetic. In the simple form 总, 糸 is omitted and the top is abbreviated.<br /><br />xxxx 悤 [cōng] (variant of 匆)<br />The old form 悤 is 囱 cōng phonetic over 心 (xīn) 'heart'. A variant, 怱, is 匆 over 心; the shape 匆, now used instead of 悤, was originally simply a variant way of writing 囱. Now some simple form characters contain 匆 over 心: e.g. 葱偬; others have the older 悤: e.g. 骢璁.<br />        Also compare 总(總) zǒng, 窗 chuāng.}	overall, general			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C1`"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">總的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C160"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">總的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%80%BB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">总在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%80%BB"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1366"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">總在RTK：general（総）</span></a>	RTH
1477	詹	詹	verbose	13	<i>bound up</i> by the <i>human legs</i> and suspended over the edge of a <i>cliff</i> - revenge for giving <i>words</i> to the police, being too <b>verbose</b>.	snitch		zhān	{There are four parts to 詹: ⺈厂八言.<br />        The top is ⺈(人) person, standing on the brink of a 厂 cliff. This was an old character pronounced zhān; it occurs also in 危 wēi 'danger'. It was used in 詹 as a phonetic, though it also suggests the meaning, since talking too much can be dangerous.<br />        The inside part is 八 or 儿 over 言. Karlgren says it is a 儿 person 言 speaking; Wieger says it is to 八 scatter one's 言 words.<br />        &quot;Talkative; supervise, control, to direct&quot; --Karlgren(1923).}	verbose, talk too much			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B8%E2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">詹的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B8E2"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">詹的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%A9%B9"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">詹在n词酷</span></a>・	RTH
1478	擔	担	to assume	16	<i>Fingers ... snitch</i>. [16]			dàn		carry, bear, undertake; shoulder responsibility			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BE%E1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">擔的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BEE1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">擔的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%8B%85"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">担在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%8B%85"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=668"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">擔在RTK：shouldering（担）</span></a>	RTH
1479	數	数	Number	15	<i>Criminal-ess ... taskmaster</i>. [15]			shù	{The component攵(攴 pū) 'beat' makes sense for clapping, tapping rythmically to facilitate in counting. The significance of 娄(婁) lóu 'go bad' is obscure.}	number, figure; to count, calculate			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BC%C6"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">數的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BCC6"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">數的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%95%B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">数在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%95%B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=929"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">數在RTK：number（数）</span></a>	RTH
1480	樓	楼	Multistory Building	15	<i>Tree ... criminal-ess</i>. 1481	獨	独	alone	16	<i>Pack of wild dogs ... butterfly net</i>. [16]		(<u>not</u> <i>lonely</i>)	dú	{From 犭(犬 quǎn) 'dog' and 蜀 shǔ ('silkworm') phonetic, simplified to 虫 (chóng 'worm').<br />        Why is 犭(犬 quǎn) 'dog' a component in 独 'alone'? Shuōwén says: "羊爲群, 犬爲獨 Yáng wéi qún, quǎn wéi dú." Maybe this refers to a lone sheep dog guarding a 群 qún herd of sheep.}	alone, independent, single, sole, only			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BFW"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">獨的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BF57"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">獨的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%8B%AC"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">独在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%8B%AC"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=522"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">獨在RTK：single（独）</span></a>	leech RTH
1482	屬	属	to belong to	21	<i>Flag ... snowflake ... butterfly net</i>. [21]			shǔ	{尸 (shǐ) here stands for 尾 (wěi) 'tail': Tail --&gt; appendage --&gt; belong to. The full form 屬 contains 蜀 shǔ ('silkworm') phonetic, where the simple form 属 has 禹 yǔ.<br />         Both Wieger (page 696, middle) and Karlgren list the simple form character 属 as a variant of 屬.}	belong to; be subordinate to			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C4%DD"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">屬的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C4DD"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">屬的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%B1%9E"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">属在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%B1%9E"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1953"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">屬在RTK：belong（属）</span></a>	RTH
1483	爛	烂	spoiled	21	<i>Fire ... gargoyle</i>. [21]		(rotted, gone bad)	làn		rotten, spoiled, decayed			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C4%EA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">爛的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C4EA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">爛的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%83%82"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">烂在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%83%82"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・	RTH
1484	蘭	兰	Orchid	21	<i>Flowers ... gargoyle</i>. [21]			lán		orchid			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C4%F5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">蘭的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C4F5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">蘭的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%85%B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">兰在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%85%B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2363"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">蘭在RTK：orchid</span></a>	RTH
1485	從	从	to follow	11				cóng	{Two 人 (rén) people, one following the other. The full form 從 has 彳 (chì) 'footprint' and (止 zhǐ) 'foot' added for emphasis. But the simple form 从 is older. Compare 比 bǐ and 众 zhòng.<br />        從 has also been used as a variant of 纵(縱) zòng.}	from; obey, follow			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B1q"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">從的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B171"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">從的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BB%8E"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">从在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BB%8E"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=877"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">從在RTK：accompany（従）</span></a>	RTH
1486	縱	纵	vertical	17	<i>Thread ... follow</i>. [17]			zòng	{From 纟(糸 sī) 'thread' and 从(從) cóng phonetic.<br />        "Slacken the rein; slack, lax, lenient, indulgent, remiss; license; admitting, even if, although; . . . (hanging slack:) perpendicular, vertical, longitudinal" --Karlgren.}	vertical; north-south lines of longitude; to indulge			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C1a"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">縱的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C161"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">縱的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%BA%B5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">纵在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E7%BA%B5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1338"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">縱在RTK：vertical（縦）</span></a>	RTH
1487	齊 	齐	identical	14		mirror image		qí	{&quot;A whole, regular and perfect harmony. The idea comes from the even height of ears in a cornfield; 禾麦吐穗, 上平也。象形。There is, in this character, an intention of representing the perspective. The lower stroke 一, says the Glose (说文), represents the foreground; the upper stroke 一 represents the background. The ears are ascending when going towards the background. Three ears represent a multitude.&quot; --Wieger.<br />        A variant form is 斉.}	even, uniform, of equal length; to make even			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%BB%F4"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">齊的字源</span></a><a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5= "><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;"> 的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=BBF4"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">齊的筆順</span></a><a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=20"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;"> 的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%BD%90"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">齐在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E9%BD%90"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1729"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">齊 在RTK：adjusted（斉）</span></a>	RTH

1489	丑	丑	Clown	4	<i>Needle ... key</i>. [4]			chǒu	{丑 [chǒu] second 地支 Earthly Branch; (F醜) 丑陋 chǒulòu ugly<br />丑 depicts a  hand which has been tied; the left 丨 vertical stroke is the rope. Phonetic in 羞 xiū, 扭钮纽狃忸 niǔ.<br />        There is another character 醜 chǒu, meaning 'ugly'. Among simple form characters 醜 is replaced by 丑, but among full form characters the two, 丑 and 醜, are still separate. 醜 is composed of 酉 (yǒu) 'wine' and 鬼 (guǐ) 'devil': "a 酉 drunk 鬼 devil" --Karlgren.}	2nd Earthly Branch; OX; [1:00am - 3:00am]; unsightly, ugly; clown, comedian			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A4%A1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">丑的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A4A1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">丑的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B8%91"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">丑在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=2040"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">丑在RTK：sign of the cow</span></a>	RTH

1491	卑	卑	lowly	8				bēi	{Picture of a cup held in the left hand (十 at the bottom is the hand).<br />        &quot;A simple cup held with one hand (the left, anciently the least polite); cf. 尊 zūn 'honoured', a fine cup presented with both hands&quot; --Karlgren.<br />        The pronunciation is the same as 杯 bēi 'cup', but this seems to be a coincidence, since the Cantonese (and Ancient) pronunciations of 卑 and 杯 are slightly different.}	low, base, vulgar, humble, inferior			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A8%F5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">卑的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A8F5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">卑的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%8D%91"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">卑在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1511"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">卑在RTK：lowly</span></a>	RTH

1493	號	号	Appellation	13	<i>Mouth ... snare ... tiger</i>. [13]			hào	{From 口 (kǒu) 'mouth' and 丂 qiǎo 'exclamation' (both phonetic and signific).<br />        The full form 號 has 虎 (hǔ) 'tiger' added to convey the idea of a tiger's roar; but the simple form 号 is older.}	day of a month; (suffix used after) name of a ship; (ordinal) number			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B8%B9"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">號的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B8B9"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">號的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%8F%B7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">号在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E5%8F%B7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1242"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">號在RTK：nickname（号）</span></a>	RTH
1494	怪	怪	peculiar	8	<i>State of mind ... crotch ... soil</i>. [8]			guài	{From 忄(心 xīn) 'heart' and 圣. 圣 here is not really 圣(聖) shèng 'holy', but an obsolete character, used in 怪 guài as a phonetic:<br />        圣 "to work in the fields -- from 又 hand and 土 earth, soil; character sometimes used as an abbreviation for 聖" --Karlgren.}	strange, unusual, peculiar			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A9%C7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">怪的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A9C7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">怪的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%80%AA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">怪在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=716"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">怪在RTK：suspicious</span></a>	RTH
1495	赤	赤	crimson	7	<i>Soil ... saber ... animal legs</i>. [7]			chì	{Originally 大 (dà) 'big' (person with arms outstretched; now 土) over 火 (huǒ) 'fire'. A 大 big red 火 fire; or a 大 person with a 火 burning emotion, blushing red.}	red, scarlet; bare, naked			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A8%AA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">赤的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A8AA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">赤的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E8%B5%A4"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">赤在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1743"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">赤在RTK：red</span></a>	RTH
1496	亦	亦	likewise	6				yì	{Picture of a 大 person, with 八 strokes indicating the sides: besides.<br />        亦 yì is a bookish word which rarely occurs in modern Mandarin. 亦 is a phonetic component in 迹 jī 'trace, remains', and in two rare characters 弈 yì and 奕 yì.<br />        The component  which occurs in 挛 luán, 变 biàn, 恋 liàn, 蛮 mán, 弯 wān, etc., has a completely different origin (it is simplified from 䜌).}	also, too; likewise			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A5%E7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">亦的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A5E7"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">亦的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%BA%A6"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">亦在n词酷</span></a>・	leech RTH
1497	極	极	Extreme	12	<i>Tree ... snare ... mouth ... crotch ... floor</i>. [12]			jí	{---- 亟 [jí] urgently&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;[qì]<br />&quot;The scholastic interpretaton is funny: a 人 man (now deformed 勹) exerting himself with 又 hand and 口 mouth between 二 heaven and earth!&quot; --Karlgren(1923).<br />        Traditionally listed under the radical 二, but now usually written with the top stroke bent, the first two strokes being like 了 (liǎo).<br />        Phonetic in the full form of 极(極) jí, also in 殛 jí 'kill' (rare).<br />        Probably no relation to 急 jí 'urgent', since 亟 ended in -k, and 急 ended in -p.}	extremely; utmost; pole (geography)			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B7%A5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">極的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B7A5"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">極的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%9E%81"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">极在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%9E%81"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=1903"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">極在RTK：poles</span></a>	RTH
1498	雜	杂	miscellaneous	18	<i>Top hat ... assembly line ... tree ... turkey</i>. [18]			zá	{Cognate with 集 jí 'collect'. Originally composed of 集 on the right and 衣 (yī) 'clothing' on the left. 集 split into 隹 and 木; 木 moved over to the left side beneath 衣; and 衣 turned into 亠 over 从, resulting in the modern full form 雜.<br />        The simple form 杂 is derived from 雜 by omitting 隹, and replacing what was once 衣 with 九.<br />        "Garments 衣 made 集 with variegated pieces stitched together; 从衣, 从集。五彩相合也。" --Wieger.}	mixed, blended, miscellaneous, various; to mix			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%C2%F8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">雜的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=C2F8"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">雜的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%9D%82"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">杂在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%9D%82"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=562"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">雜在RTK：miscellaneous（雑）</span></a>	RTH
1499	曰	曰	sayeth	4				yuē		to speak, say&nbsp;&nbsp;(older style)			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%A4%EA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">曰的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=A4EA"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">曰的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E6%9B%B0"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">曰在n词酷</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=578"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">曰在RTK：sayeth</span></a>	RTH
1500	亂	乱	Chaos	13	<i>Claw ... chop ... belt ... elbow ... crotch ... fishhook</i>. [13]			luàn	{The original meaning was 'unravel':<br />        &quot;爪又 two hands working with 幺 silk threads hung up on 冂 a stand&quot; --Karlgren.<br />        乚 was added to represent one of the threads. The simplification of the left side to 舌 is at least a thousand years old (广韵). The meaning has drifted from 'unravel' to 'disorder'. Although 乱 was not really derived from 舌 shé 'tongue', one might construe sticking one's 舌 tongue out as a form of 乱 disorderly conduct.<br />        Variants: 𤔔𤔐𤔬𠦸𠧎𠧏𤔦𠃶𠃹𢮣𤔒𠃿.}	in confusion, disorderly; state of chaos			<a href="http://zhongwen.com/cgi-bin/zipux2.cgi?b5=%B6%C3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">亂的字源</span></a>・<a href="http://stroke-order.learningweb.moe.edu.tw/word_detail.jsp?big5=B6C3"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">亂的筆順</span></a>・<a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B9%B1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">乱在n词酷（</span></a><a href="http://www.nciku.com/search/zh/%E4%B9%B1"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#550000;">简体字）</span></a>・<a href="http://kanji.koohii.com/study/?framenum=72"><span style="text-decoration: underline; color:#005500;">亂在RTK：riot（乱）</span></a>	RTH
1121P	辟		hot sauce	13			(ketchup)(P)		辟[-/闢] ²pì v. ①open up; start ②refute; repudiate; eliminate ◆b.f. penetrating; incisive<br /><br />From 尸(卩 jié) 'seal', 口 (kǒu) 'mouth' and 辛 (xīn) 'criminal'.<br />        "A 卩 (seal-holder:) magistrate 口 pronouncing a sentence over a 辛 criminal" --Karlgren.					RTH RTH-prim
1116P	离		Fagan	10			(P)		离 lí originally showed a bird (top) being caught in a net (or leaving the net?). Now the bird is 亠 two strokes. The net is still recognizable by the 㐅 crossing strokes (see 毕畢 bì).<br />        The full form 離 has an additional 隹 (zhūi) bird.<br />        Compare 禽 qín 'birds'.					RTH RTH-prim
1110P	Top of 學,覺,澩		Carmen Miranda hat	13			(P)		{The top  shows two hands around 爻 (yáo) lines in the symbols of the 易经 Yì Jīng Book of Changes, over 冖 something like a cover. One uncovers the truth by grasping the 爻 changes. 子 (zǐ) 'child' was added to the bottom since children are good at learning.<br />        The simple form 学, in which the top is three dots, is at least as old as the fourth century A.D. Distinguish it from 字 zì which has only one dot on top. Compare 觉(覺) jué 'feel' and 教 jiāo jiào 'teach'.}					RTH RTH-prim
1108P	乂		sheaf	2			(P)		==== 乂 [yì] regulate; put in order; stabilize; (component: 义风杀希区爻...)<br />"Picture of some kind of scissors, lawn-mower" --Karlgren.					RTH RTH-prim

1132P	圥		"rice seedling"	5			(mushroom)(P)		xxxx 圥 [lù] (component: 'mushroom'; occurs in 坴, 夌, 续)					RTH RTH-prim

1175P	堇		spinach	11			(P)		(left of 勤)<br />{==== 堇 [jǐn] 堇菜 violet (flower)<br />The history of 堇 is messy. First of all, when it means 'violet', 堇 jǐn really is from 艹(草 cǎo) 'plant'. Where it is used as a component in other characters, 堇 has a different origin: it is related to , and it may have meant 'clay'.}					RTH RTH-prim
1178P	(left of 艱)		Popeye	11			(P)		{"The graph shows a man (prisoner?) with back-bound hands" --Karlren(1940).<br />        The meaning was 'distress' or 'difficulty', now written 艰(艱) jiān.<br />        Of course, there are other theories.<br />        As a component,  is reduced to 又 in the simple forms of 汉(漢) hàn, 难(難) nán, 叹(嘆) tàn, and 艰(艱) jiān.}					RTH RTH-prim
1181P	(middle of 華 or 垂)		silage	6			(P)							RTH RTH-prim
1216P	(top right of 侯)		key	2			(P)		{target}					RTH RTH-prim
1218P	夬 (right of 決)		guillotine	4			(P)		{==== 夬 [guài]  Break-through (Resoluteness)<br />The oracle-bone character (from 王宏源) seems to show two hands holding a large U shape. Such a penannular jade ring was called a 玦 jué. In ancient times the jué symbolized authority, or cutting off a relationship. An archer's thumbring was also called a 玦 jué. The meaning 'break-through' might derive from the missing portion of the ring, where it is broken through; or from "the bursting loose of the bow string" as Karlgren says. The name of the hexagram  guài is just a slight variation of jué.<br />        决 jué as in 决定 juédìng 'decide' is a cognate word.}					RTH RTH-prim
1240P	柬		horned toad	9	a <i>bundle</i> of <i>animal horns</i>.		(P)		{&quot;Choose...abridge...short note...visiting card --- to 八 divide a 束 bundle: choose&quot; --Karlgren(1923).<br />        Compare 束 shù 'bundle'. 柬 is etymologically the same word as 简 jiǎn 'simple' and 拣 jiǎn 'choose'.<br />        As a component, 柬 becomes  in the simplified forms of 拣(揀) jiǎn 'choose', 炼(煉) liàn 'refine', and 练(練) liàn 'practice'. Please note that  is not the same as 东(東 dōng 'east') -- the third stroke is different.}	柬 ¹²jiǎn b.f. letter; card; invitation				RTH RTH-prim
1247P	疒		sickness	5	<i>cave</i> with <i>ice</i> outside of it. <br>a <i>cave</i>man nurcing a hangover with an <i>ice</i>-pack		(P)		{Picture of a person lying on a bed, written sideways. The bed is on the left side.<br>        疒 is the 104th Kangxi radical.<br>        See 病 bìng, 疾 jí, etc.}					RTH RTH-prim
1250P	匚(匸)		box	2			(P)		{Picture of a basket or water-jug, turned on its side.<br>        22nd of the 214 radicals.<br>        Compare 匸 xì, which is the 23rd radical. In modern writing there is rarely any distinction between 匚 and 匸.}					RTH RTH-prim

1377P	釆		droppings	7	<i>drops of ... rice</i>. [7]		(P)		{Seven strokes. 釆 is NOT the same as 采 cǎi (which is 爫 over 木).<br />        &quot;Picture of an animal's track&quot; --Karlgren.<br />        &quot;The steps of a wild beast 象. The strokes represent the print of the claws, and the points the print of the soft parts. The examination of the trail indicating the kind of animal, hence the extended meaning, to discriminate, to part, to sort out. The excreta giving the same indication, 釆 means dung in 粪. It is unconnected with 米&quot; --Wieger.}					RTH RTH-prim

1475P	囱		GPS	7			chimney(P)		{---- 囱(F囪) [cōng] 烟囱 yāncōng chimney<br />Picture of a window, skylight, or vent. N0001P	𣪠 (top of&nbsp;&nbsp;擊 ) 		Juggernaut	13	war chariot with missiles...				{xxxx 𣪠 (old form of 击(擊) jī)<br />The original form was 毄, from 軎 and 殳. Reduced by one stroke, from 毄 to 𣪠, when occuring as a component in 擊, 繋, and 墼.}<br />{573&nbsp;&nbsp;击(F擊) [jī] beat<br />Originally 毄, from 軎([wèi] shaft of a carriage) and 殳 (shū) 'beat'. The meaning was, to jostle or bump, 口 representing the end of a 車 (chē) war chariot's axle. 毄 became 𣪠 by the omission of one stroke. Then a 手 (shǒu) hand was added, forming 擊. The modern simple form is 击.<br />        Compare 繋 xì, also a rare character 墼 jī.}	to attack				RTH RTH-new RTH-prim

0595P	雚		stork	18	(stork: Here we have a senile, old turkey that thinks its a stork. The element for chatterbox refers to the incessant gobbling of the turkey, who is doing its best to keep its bundle in its stubby beak while he announces the new arrival to the entire neighborhood. The fragrant flowers have been added to improve the odor of the parcel. [18])			guàn	{Picture of a heron. From 艹, 吅, and 隹 (zhuī) 'short-tailed bird'.<br />        "The 吅 crying 隹 bird with 艸 tufts on its head; or 吅 . . . might be phonetic" --Karlgren.}					RTH RTH-prim
N0009	吊	吊	hang down	6	<i>Mouth .... towel</i>.		(<u>not</u> <i>to hand down</i>, <u>not</u> <i>to hang</i>!)	diào	{1728 吊 [diào] hang; lift up, let down with rope; crane; mourn; revoke<br />Originally composed of 人 (rén) 'person' and 弓 (gōng) 'bow', an 人 archer with a 弓 bow (not in use) hanging from the shoulder.<br />        A variant form is 弔. The modern form 吊 is thoroughly distorted, so we might remember it better as a 巾 (jīn) napkin hanging down while in suspended between the 口 (kǒu) mouth and the lap or table.}	condole; hang; lift up; revoke; suspend				RTH RTH-new
N0010	蔑	蔑	scornful	15	<i>Squint</i>苜 .. <i>defend</i>戍.			miè	{蔑 ³miè b.f. disdain; scorn<br />From 苜 miè ('squint') phonetic over 戍 (shù) 'defend'.<br />        The top, 艹 over 罒, is not 苜 mù 'alfalfa', but 苜 miè 'squint', same as the top of 夢 mèng 'dream' and 瞢 méng 'dim sight'.<br />        &quot;Be without; not exist; nothing, not; insignificant, trifling&quot; --Karlgren.<br />        A cognate word is 篾 miè 'thin bamboo strip'.}					RTH RTH-new

N0013	致	致	convey	10	<i>Until .. taskmaster</i>.			zhì	{599&nbsp;&nbsp;致 [zhì] send, convey; 一致 yízhì identical; (F緻) 细致 xìzhì careful<br />致 ⁶zhì v. ①send; extend; deliver ②return; give up ◆b.f. ①incur; cause ②invite; collect (scholars/etc.) ③devote (one's efforts, etc.); concentrate on; work for ④charm ⑤fascination; interest <br />According to Karlgren, 致 zhì is cognate to 至 zhì, the primary meaning being 'go to'. The right side of 致 was 夂 (zhǐ), a foot pointing downward, accidentally changed to 攵(攴 pū) 'strike'.}	to send; to devote; to deliver; to cause; to convey				RTH RTH-new
N0014	緻	致	meticulous	16	<i>Thread .. convey</i>.			zhì	{緻[致] ⁷zhì b.f. fine; delicate; meticulous<br />From 糸 and 致. Maybe the same word etymologically as 致. N0016	析	析	analyze	8	<i>Tree .. axe</i>.			xī	析 ¹⁵xī b.f. ①divide; separate ②analyze <br>From 木 (mù) 'wood' and 斤 (jīn) 'axe'.<br>        Use an 斤 axe to chop up 木 wood: cut up, analyse.<br>        "To cleave, split, divide; analyse, explain, judge -- an 斤 axe splitting a 木 tree" 	analyse; dissect; divide; separate				RTH RTH-new
N0017	溥	溥	broad [vast]	13	<i>Water氵 .. gummed label尃</i>.			pǔ	{溥 ⁵pǔ b.f. broad; extensive; universal<br />From 氵(水 shuǐ) 'water' and 尃 fū ('spread') phonetic.<br />        &quot;Vast, universal&quot; --Karlgren(1923).<br />        Compare 普 pǔ which has the same meanings; perhaps 溥 and 普 are etymologically the same word. N0019	畢	毕	graduate	11	<i>Brain .. salad .. needle.</i>			bì	{839&nbsp;&nbsp;畢(S毕) [bì] 畢業 bìyè graduate; 畢竟 bìjìng after all<br />畢[毕] ⁸bì b.f. ①finish ¹wánbì ②accomplish; conclude ¹bìyè ◆adv. 〈wr.〉 fully; altogether ◆n. Surname<br />Picture of a net for catching birds. The full form 畢 has 田 tián 'field' at the top. In the simple form 毕 the top is 比 bǐ phonetic.<br />        Compare 离 lí, which originally showed the same net with a bird.<br />        Don't confuse 毕(畢) bì with 华(華) huá.}	whole; completely; to accomplish				RTH RTH-new
N0020	紹	绍	to hand down 	11	<i>Thread ... summon</i>.			shào	{948&nbsp;&nbsp;紹(S绍) [shào] 介紹 jièshào introduce<br />紹[绍] ⁴shào b.f. ①continue; connect shàojì jièshào ②short for Shàoxīng (in Zhejiang)<br />From 纟(糸 sī) 'thread' and 召 zhào phonetic. 糸 suggests the meaning &quot;tie together, connect&quot;, which is what you do with two people when you introduce them.}	to bring together; to continue				RTH RTH-new
N0021	址	址	address	7	<i>Ground .. stop</i>.			zhǐ	{1366 址 [zhǐ] 地址 dìzhǐ address<br />址 ⁹zhǐ b.f. ①foundation of a building ¹yízhǐ ②position<br />From 土 (tǔ) 'ground' and 止 zhǐ (picture of a foot).<br />        "Foot of a mountain, foundation, base" --Karlgren.<br />        Etymologically the same word as 止 zhǐ 'stop' and 趾 zhǐ 'foot', specifyingly enlarged by 土.}	location; site				RTH RTH-new
N0022	棄	弃	abandon	12	<i>Baby .. twenty .. tree</i>.			qì	{The top  is 子 (zǐ) 'baby' upside down. The bottom 廾 derives from  two hands pushing away the baby, abandoning it.<br />        In some old forms the baby seems to be in a basket (其 qí). That basket (or a shovel for throwing away the baby) may survive in the full form 棄.}	reject, abandon, discard				RTH RTH-new

N0035	戊		5th of the 10 Heavenly Stems	5		/RTH: parade (p)/	(also <i>parade (p)</i>)	wù	{戊 ⁸wù n. 5th of the 10 Heavenly Stems<br />Picture of some kind of weapon, like 戈 gē. Compare the top of 越 yuè.}			62 戈		HeavenlyStems RTH RTH-new
N0036	己(6th Heavenly Stem)		6th of the 10 Heavenly Stems	3			(also <i>self</i>)	jǐ	{己 may have depicted thread on a loom; an ancient meaning was 'unravel threads', which was later written 紀 jì. 己 was borrowed both for the word jǐ 'self', and for the name of the sixth Heavenly Stem (天干).<br />        Compare 已 yǐ 'already' and 巳 sì the sixth Earthly Branch.}					HeavenlyStems RTH RTH-new
N0037	庚		7th of the 10 Heavenly Stems	8	<i>Cave ... rake ... ?(person?)</i>			gēng	{Picture of a tool for threshing grain. In the oldest form the tool appears to be leaning against a table; subsequently  two hands are shown holding the tool.<br>        &quot;To bark the rice by pounding it in a mortar. This was the main daily domestic work among the ancients&quot; --Wieger.<br>        庚 is a component in 康 kāng, 唐 táng, 庸 yōng, and 赓 gēng.}					HeavenlyStems RTH RTH-new
N0038	辛(8th of the 10 Heavenly Stems)		8th of the 10 Heavenly Stems	7			(also <i>peppery</i>)	xīn	{&quot;The seal has 𢆉 'knock against, offend' below, and 亠 above; the scholastic commentators say: to offend (亠 = ) 上 the superiors&quot; --Karlgren.<br>        辛 xīn is not to be confused with 幸 xìng 'lucky'.<br>        Phonetic in 亲 qīn etc.}					HeavenlyStems RTH RTH-new
N0039	壬		9th of the 10 Heavenly Stems	4			(also <i>porter(p)</i>)	rén	{壬 rén depicts &quot;a 丨 carrying pole supported 一 in the middle part and having one object attached at each end, as always done in China&quot; --Karlgren(1923). (See 扁担 biǎndan).<br>        Now the character 任 rèn has the meaning of carrying a burden, and the original character 壬 is used only for the ninth of the ten heavenly stems (天干).<br><br>Another old character, which now only occurs as a component in other characters, is now written the same way: 壬. It depicted a 人 person standing on the 土 ground. The pronunciation would be tǐng if it weren't obsolete; it is a phonetic component in 廷 tíng, 呈 chéng, 聽 tīng, etc.<br>        Don't confuse 壬 rén with 王 wáng 'king'.}					HeavenlyStems RTH RTH-new
N0040	癸		10th of the 10 Heavenly Stems	9	<i>Teepee .. Heavens</i>.			guǐ	{&quot;The nicely disposed grass, on which the Ancients poured the libations offered to the Manes; see Graphies, page 362. This character, not easily written, was replaced, in the days of 李斯 Lǐsī, by 癶 plus 矢, probably the primitive form of 发 fā. The modern form has been arbitrarily mutilated by the scribes. Now 假借 jiǎjiè a cyclical character&quot; --Wieger.}					HeavenlyStems RTH RTH-new
N0041	詳	详	detailed	13	<i>Words ... sheep</i>.			xiáng						RTH RTH-new
